question.title: Will Coca-Cola recall any products due to metal contamination by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Coca-Cola announces a recall of any of its products due to metal contamination. The recall must be officially confirmed by Coca-Cola or a relevant food safety authority (such as the U.S. Department of Agriculture's Food Safety and Inspection Service) and reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, CNN, New York Times). The contamination must specifically involve metal materials found in the food products. If no such recall occurs within the specified timeframe, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will Coca-Cola issue a recall for any items because of metal contamination before August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if, on or before August 31, 2024, Coca-Cola declares a recall of any of its items due to metal contamination. The recall must be officially verified by Coca-Cola or an appropriate food safety authority (such as the U.S. Department of Agriculture's Food Safety and Inspection Service) and reported by a minimum of two credible news outlets (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, CNN, New York Times). The contamination must specifically involve metallic substances present in the food products. If no such recall takes place within the given timeframe, the inquiry will be deemed negative.

The contamination must specifically involve metal substances found in the food items. If either company fails to announce such a recall within the given timeframe, the question will be resolved as NO.

question.title: Will Land O'Frost issue a recall of deli meats due to a listeria outbreak by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Land O'Frost officially announces a recall of any of its deli meat products due to a listeria outbreak. The recall must be confirmed through at least one of the following sources:

1. An official announcement on Land O'Frost's website or social media channels
2. A press release from Land O'Frost
3. An announcement from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) specifically mentioning a Land O'Frost recall
4. Reports from at least three major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, CNN, New York Times) citing official sources

The recall must explicitly mention listeria as the reason for the product withdrawal. If no such recall meeting these criteria is announced by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Land O'Frost will recall deli meats because of a listeria outbreak before August 2024?
para_P.body:

2. A press release issued by Land O'Frost
3. An announcement from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) that specifically refers to a Land O'Frost recall
4. Coverage by a minimum of three major news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, CNN, New York Times) citing authoritative sources

The recall must clearly state listeria as the cause for the product withdrawal. If no recall that meets these criteria is made public by the specified date, the inquiry will be deemed FALSE.

question.title: Will Illinois hold a referendum on healthcare reform by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the state of Illinois officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enacting healthcare reform in the state. The referendum must be officially announced by the Illinois Secretary of State or other appropriate state election authority, and must be scheduled to take place on or before August 31, 2024. The referendum question must directly address the issue of healthcare reform. This question will resolve as NO if no such referendum is officially announced or conducted by the specified date. Note that merely gathering signatures for a potential referendum does not qualify for a YES resolution; the actual referendum must be scheduled or held within the specified timeframe.

para_P.title: Is there a plan for Illinois to conduct a public vote on healthcare reform before August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with YES if, by August 31, 2024, the state of Illinois officially carries out a public vote specifically aimed at implementing healthcare reform within the state. The public vote must be formally declared by the Illinois Secretary of State or another relevant state election authority, and it must be set to occur on or before August 31, 2024. The question posed in the vote must specifically relate to the topic of healthcare reform. This inquiry will be answered with NO if no such public vote is officially declared or held by the specified date. It is important to note that simply collecting signatures for a possible vote does not qualify for a YES resolution; the actual vote must be scheduled or conducted within the given timeframe.

question.title: Will Pennsylvania hold a referendum on renewable energy initiatives by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Pennsylvania conducts an official public referendum specifically focused on implementing renewable energy initiatives in the state. For a YES resolution, the following criteria must be met:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of Pennsylvania.
2. The primary focus of the referendum must be on renewable energy initiatives.
3. The results of the referendum must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

If no such referendum occurs or is completed by August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Proposed referendums that have not been officially conducted by the resolution date do not count for a YES resolution.

para_P.title: Will Pennsylvania conduct a public vote on renewable energy projects before the end of August 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with YES if, by August 31, 2024, Pennsylvania carries out an official public vote that specifically addresses the implementation of renewable energy projects within the state. For a YES outcome, the following conditions must be satisfied:

1. The public vote must be officially declared and executed by the state of Pennsylvania.
2. The main emphasis of the public vote must be on renewable energy projects.
3. The outcomes of the public vote must be disclosed through official state communications or prominent news outlets.

If no such public vote takes place or is finalized by August 31, 2024, the inquiry will conclude with NO. Proposed public votes that have not been officially carried out by the resolution deadline do not qualify for a YES outcome.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by August 2024: (a) Illinois holds a referendum on healthcare reform, and (b) Pennsylvania holds a referendum on renewable energy initiatives?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following occur by August 31, 2024:

(a) The state of Illinois officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enacting healthcare reform. The referendum must be officially announced by the Illinois Secretary of State or other appropriate state election authority, and must be scheduled to take place on or before August 31, 2024. The referendum question must directly address the issue of healthcare reform. Merely gathering signatures for a potential referendum does not qualify for a YES resolution; the actual referendum must be scheduled or held within the specified timeframe.

(b) Pennsylvania conducts an official public referendum specifically focused on implementing renewable energy initiatives. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of Pennsylvania, with the primary focus on renewable energy initiatives. The results of the referendum must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources. Proposed referendums that have not been officially conducted by the resolution date do not count for a YES resolution.

If both (a) and (b) occur by the specified date, this question will resolve as YES. If either (a) or (b) does not occur, it will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Is it true that by August 2024, both Illinois will have a referendum on healthcare reform and Pennsylvania will have a referendum on renewable energy initiatives?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with a YES if the following two events take place by August 31, 2024:

(a) Illinois officially carries out a public referendum aimed at healthcare reform. This referendum must be announced by the Illinois Secretary of State or another relevant election authority and scheduled to occur on or before August 31, 2024. The referendum question must specifically deal with healthcare reform. Simply collecting signatures for a potential referendum does not qualify for a YES answer; the actual referendum must be planned or executed within the given timeframe.

(b) Pennsylvania holds an official public referendum that specifically targets the implementation of renewable energy initiatives. This referendum must be announced and conducted by the state of Pennsylvania, focusing primarily on renewable energy initiatives. The outcomes of the referendum must be reported by official state sources or widely recognized news outlets. Proposed referendums that have not been officially conducted by the resolution date will not count towards a YES answer.

If both (a) and (b) take place by the designated date, this question will be answered with a YES. If either (a) or (b) does not take place, the answer will be NO.

question.title: Will Google's AI assistant be reported for spreading election misinformation by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that Google's AI assistant is spreading election misinformation. For the purpose of this question, 'election misinformation' refers to false or misleading information about election processes, candidates, or results. Credible reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. The reports or warnings must specifically mention the AI assistant and its role in spreading election misinformation. If no such reports or warnings are issued by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Will there be reports of Google's AI assistant disseminating false information regarding elections by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed TRUE if, by August 31, 2024, credible accounts or official alerts from election authorities, government entities, or trustworthy news organizations indicate that Google's AI assistant is disseminating false information about elections. For this question, 'false information about elections' encompasses inaccurate or deceptive information concerning electoral processes, candidates, or outcomes. Credible accounts should originate from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election authorities, prominent news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US television networks), or peer-reviewed research published in respected journals. The accounts or alerts must explicitly reference the AI assistant and its involvement in spreading false information about elections. If no such accounts or alerts are made public by the resolution date, the inquiry will be considered FALSE.

question.title: Will the CMA announce completion of a major digital advertising practices investigation by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Competition and Markets Authority (CMA) of the UK officially announces the completion of its investigation into digital advertising practices involving at least five major companies. Completion must be confirmed through an official CMA announcement or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, or New York Times). If the CMA does not announce the completion of such an investigation by this date, or if the investigation is still ongoing, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will the CMA declare that a significant inquiry into digital advertising practices has concluded by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered YES if, by July 31, 2024, the UK's Competition and Markets Authority (CMA) makes an official statement regarding the conclusion of its investigation into digital advertising practices that involve at least five prominent companies. The conclusion must be verified through a formal announcement from the CMA or reported by a minimum of two major news organizations (such as Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, or New York Times). If the CMA fails to announce the conclusion of this investigation by the specified date, or if the investigation remains active, the inquiry will be deemed NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Google's AI assistant be reported for spreading election misinformation by August 2024 and (b) the CMA announce completion of a major digital advertising practices investigation by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met: (a) By August 31, 2024, there are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that Google's AI assistant is spreading election misinformation. 'Election misinformation' refers to false or misleading information about election processes, candidates, or results. Credible reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. The reports or warnings must specifically mention the AI assistant and its role in spreading election misinformation. If no such reports or warnings are issued by the resolution date, this condition is not met. (b) By July 31, 2024, the Competition and Markets Authority (CMA) of the UK officially announces the completion of its investigation into digital advertising practices involving at least five major companies. Completion must be confirmed through an official CMA announcement or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, or New York Times). If the CMA does not announce the completion of such an investigation by this date, or if the investigation is still ongoing, this condition is not met. Both conditions must be satisfied for the question to resolve as YES.

para_P.title: Is it possible that both the following events will take place: (a) there will be reports of Google's AI assistant disseminating election misinformation by August 2024, and (b) the CMA will declare the conclusion of a significant investigation into digital advertising practices by July 2024?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with a YES if both of the subsequent criteria are fulfilled: (a) By August 31, 2024, credible sources or official alerts from election authorities, government entities, or trustworthy news organizations indicate that Google's AI assistant has been involved in spreading election misinformation. 'Election misinformation' is defined as incorrect or deceptive information regarding electoral processes, candidates, or outcomes. Credible sources must include at least two of the following: state or federal election officials, prominent news organizations (like Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed research published in respected journals. The alerts or reports must clearly identify the AI assistant and its involvement in the dissemination of election misinformation. If such reports or alerts are not provided by the resolution date, this criterion will not be met. (b) By July 31, 2024, the UK's Competition and Markets Authority (CMA) must formally announce that it has completed its investigation into digital advertising practices involving at least five major companies. This completion must be verified through an official announcement by the CMA or reported by at least two major news organizations (such as Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, or New York Times). If the CMA fails to announce the completion of this investigation by the specified date, or if the investigation remains ongoing, this condition will not be satisfied. Both criteria must be met for the question to resolve as YES.

question.title: Will Union Pacific implement a new scheduling system for freight train operations by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Union Pacific Railroad announces and implements a new scheduling system aimed at making schedules more predictable for freight train operations. The implementation must be confirmed through official company statements or reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The new system must be specifically designed to address the quality of life concerns related to schedule predictability for freight train operations. If no such system is implemented and confirmed by the resolution date, or if the implemented system does not specifically target schedule predictability for freight train operations, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Is Union Pacific going to introduce a new scheduling system for freight train operations before August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered TRUE if, by August 31, 2024, Union Pacific Railroad announces and puts into action a new scheduling system intended to enhance the predictability of schedules for freight train operations. The execution of this system must be validated through official announcements from the company or reported by at least two credible news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The new system must specifically aim to improve the quality of life concerning schedule predictability for freight train operations. If no such system is implemented and confirmed by the resolution date, or if the system that is implemented does not specifically focus on enhancing schedule predictability for freight train operations, the inquiry will be deemed FALSE.

question.title: Will Union Pacific reach a new agreement with the conductors' union addressing work schedule predictability by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Union Pacific and the union representing train conductors publicly announce a new agreement that specifically addresses work schedule predictability for conductors. The agreement must be officially confirmed by both Union Pacific and the union, and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, Bloomberg, or major national newspapers). The agreement should directly address the issue of making schedules more predictable for train conductors, as mentioned in the ongoing dispute. If no such agreement is reached, announced, and reported by the resolution date, or if an announced agreement does not specifically address work schedule predictability, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Will Union Pacific finalize a new deal with the conductors' union regarding predictable work schedules by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a YES if, by August 31, 2024, Union Pacific and the union that represents train conductors publicly declare a new deal that explicitly pertains to the predictability of work schedules for conductors. The deal must be officially validated by both Union Pacific and the union, and reported by at least two prominent news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, Bloomberg, or major national newspapers). The agreement should specifically tackle the matter of enhancing schedule predictability for train conductors, as highlighted in the ongoing conflict. If such a deal is not reached, announced, and reported by the resolution date, or if an announced deal does not specifically focus on work schedule predictability, the question will resolve as NO.

question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following occur by August 31, 2024: (a) Union Pacific Railroad announces and implements a new scheduling system aimed at making schedules more predictable for freight train operations. The implementation must be confirmed through official company statements or reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The new system must be specifically designed to address the quality of life concerns related to schedule predictability for freight train operations. (b) Union Pacific and the union representing train conductors publicly announce a new agreement that specifically addresses work schedule predictability for conductors. The agreement must be officially confirmed by both Union Pacific and the union, and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, Bloomberg, or major national newspapers). The agreement should directly address the issue of making schedules more predictable for train conductors, as mentioned in the ongoing dispute. If either condition (a) or (b) is not met by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Is Union Pacific set to introduce a new freight train scheduling system and finalize a new agreement with the conductors' union regarding work schedule predictability by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if both of the following take place by August 31, 2024: (a) Union Pacific Railroad reveals and puts into action a new scheduling system designed to enhance the predictability of schedules for freight train operations. The implementation must be validated through official company announcements or covered by at least two credible news organizations (like Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The new system must specifically target the quality of life issues related to schedule predictability for freight train operations. (b) Union Pacific and the union that represents train conductors publicly declare a new agreement that explicitly addresses the predictability of work schedules for conductors. The agreement should directly tackle the matter of improving schedule predictability for train conductors, as referenced in the ongoing dispute. If either condition (a) or (b) is unmet by the resolution date, the inquiry will conclude with a NO.

question.title: Will another U.S. state adopt a Medicaid plan with a community engagement requirement by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, at least one U.S. state other than Georgia officially adopts a Medicaid plan that includes a community engagement requirement for beneficiaries. The community engagement requirement must be a key component of the plan. For a positive resolution, there must be an official announcement from the state government or the state's Medicaid agency, or consistent reporting from at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, or Washington Post). The plan must be officially adopted, not merely proposed or under consideration. If no other state adopts such a plan by July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible for another U.S. state to implement a Medicaid program that requires community engagement by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, by July 31, 2024, at least one additional U.S. state, excluding Georgia, formally implements a Medicaid program that mandates community engagement for its beneficiaries. The community engagement aspect must be a fundamental element of the program. For a positive outcome, there needs to be an official declaration from the state government or its Medicaid agency, or consistent coverage from a minimum of two credible national news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, or Washington Post). The program must be officially enacted, rather than simply suggested or under review. If no other state enacts such a program by July 31, 2024, the answer will be NO.

question.title: Will U.S. weekly jobless claims exceed 275,000 for four consecutive weeks by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the number of weekly initial jobless claims in the United States, as reported by the U.S. Department of Labor, exceeds 275,000 for four consecutive weeks at any point between now and August 31, 2024. The question will resolve as NO if this condition is not met within the specified timeframe. For resolution purposes, only official data released by the U.S. Department of Labor will be considered.

para_P.title: Will the number of weekly jobless claims in the U.S. surpass 275,000 for four straight weeks before August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if the weekly initial jobless claims in the United States, as documented by the U.S. Department of Labor, go beyond 275,000 for four consecutive weeks at any time from now until August 31, 2024. It will be answered with a NO if this scenario does not occur within the given timeframe. For the purpose of resolution, only the official statistics released by the U.S. Department of Labor will be taken into account.

para_P.title: Is it possible that by August 2024, both of the following will take place: (a) A different U.S. state implements a Medicaid program with a requirement for community engagement by July 2024 (b) Weekly jobless claims in the U.S. surpass 275,000 for a duration of four consecutive weeks?

question.title: Will the headquarters of a major cybersecurity company be fully relocated to Austin, Texas by July 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, a major cybersecurity company has fully relocated its headquarters from its original location to Austin, Texas. For the resolution to be affirmative:

1. The relocation must be officially announced by the company or its leadership.
2. The announcement must be reported by at least two major, reputable news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, New York Times).
3. The new headquarters must be operational in Austin, Texas, with key executive functions transferred.

Partial relocations or plans still in progress by July 31, 2024, will not be sufficient for a YES resolution. If the move is not completed and operational by this date, or if the company decides against the move, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will a significant cybersecurity firm completely shift its headquarters to Austin, Texas by July 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be deemed affirmative if, by July 31, 2024, a significant cybersecurity firm has entirely moved its headquarters from its previous location to Austin, Texas. For the answer to be YES:

1. The move must be officially declared by the company or its executives.
2. The declaration must be covered by at least two major, trustworthy news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, New York Times).
3. The new headquarters must be operational in Austin, Texas, with essential executive functions transferred.

The referendum must be a legitimate, state-wide vote on a proposed constitutional amendment or legislative action specifically related to healthcare funding. The occurrence of the referendum must be confirmed through official announcements from the state government or reports from at least three major, credible news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, or CNN). If no such referendum takes place by the designated date, or if a scheduled referendum is cancelled or delayed past July 31, 2024, the inquiry will be considered FALSE. It is important to note that this question solely pertains to the occurrence of the referendum, not its result.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by July 2024: (a) Harvard University fully covers tuition for medical students from lower-income families, and (b) Illinois holds a referendum on healthcare funding?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met by July 31, 2024: 

(a) Harvard University officially implements a policy to fully cover tuition for medical students from families earning less than $100,000 annually. The confirmation must come from official university announcements or reports from at least two reputable news sources (e.g., The New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Reuters, Associated Press). The policy must be in effect for the 2024-2025 academic year or earlier. If such a policy is not confirmed to be in place by the resolution date, or if the income threshold or coverage details differ significantly from those specified, this part resolves as NO.

(b) The state of Illinois officially conducts a referendum regarding healthcare funding. The referendum must be a formal, state-wide vote on a proposed constitutional amendment or legislative measure specifically addressing healthcare funding. The occurrence of the referendum must be verifiable through official state government announcements or reports from at least three major, reputable news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, or CNN). If no such referendum is held by the specified date, or if a planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond July 31, 2024, this part resolves as NO.

The combined question resolves as YES only if both (a) and (b) occur by the specified date.

para_P.title: By July 2024, will the following two events take place: (a) Harvard University provides complete tuition coverage for medical students from low-income households, and (b) Illinois conducts a vote on healthcare financing?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered affirmatively if both of the subsequent criteria are satisfied by July 31, 2024: 

(a) Harvard University officially adopts a policy to fully finance the tuition of medical students from families with an annual income below $100,000. Verification must come from official announcements from the university or reports from at least two credible news outlets (such as The New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Reuters, Associated Press). This policy must be operational for the 2024-2025 academic year or sooner. If such a policy is not confirmed by the resolution date, or if the income limit or coverage specifics vary significantly from what is stated, this part will resolve as NO.

(b) The state of Illinois formally holds a referendum concerning healthcare funding. This referendum must be an official, state-wide vote on a proposed constitutional change or legislative action specifically related to healthcare financing. The occurrence of the referendum must be verifiable through official state government communications or reports from at least three major, trustworthy news organizations (like Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, or CNN). If no such referendum occurs by the designated date, or if a planned referendum is canceled or delayed beyond July 31, 2024, this part will resolve as NO.

The overall question will resolve as YES only if both (a) and (b) take place by the indicated date.

question.title: Will Alibaba announce measures to reduce AI-related electricity consumption by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Alibaba officially announces specific measures aimed at reducing electricity consumption attributed to its AI operations. The announcement must be made through official company channels (such as press releases, blog posts, or annual reports) or reported by at least two major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, Wall Street Journal, New York Times). The measures announced should be concrete steps or initiatives designed to decrease the energy usage of Alibaba's AI systems. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, or if the announced measures do not specifically target AI-related electricity consumption, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will Alibaba reveal strategies to cut down on electricity usage linked to AI by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered YES if, by July 31, 2024, Alibaba makes an official declaration regarding specific strategies intended to lower the electricity consumption associated with its AI activities. The declaration must be communicated through official company platforms (like press releases, blog entries, or annual reports) or covered by at least two prominent news organizations (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, Wall Street Journal, New York Times). The strategies disclosed should comprise tangible steps or initiatives aimed at reducing the energy consumption of Alibaba's AI systems. If no such declaration occurs by the given deadline, or if the strategies announced do not specifically address AI-related electricity consumption, the inquiry will be deemed NO.

question.title: Will New York hold a referendum on climate change policies by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the state of New York officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on implementing climate change policies in the state. The referendum must be officially announced by the New York Secretary of State or other appropriate state election authority, and must be scheduled to take place on or before August 31, 2024. The referendum question must directly address the issue of climate change policies. This question will resolve as NO if no such referendum is officially announced or conducted by the specified date. Note that merely gathering signatures for a potential referendum does not qualify for a YES resolution; the actual referendum must be scheduled or held within the specified timeframe.

para_P.title: Will New York conduct a public vote on climate change measures before August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with YES if, by August 31, 2024, the state of New York officially carries out a public vote specifically aimed at adopting climate change measures within the state. The question posed in the vote must explicitly relate to climate change measures. This inquiry will be answered with NO if no such public vote is officially declared or executed by the given date. Note that simply collecting signatures for a potential public vote does not count for a YES resolution; the actual vote must be scheduled or take place within the specified period.

question.title: Will Google announce additional layoffs beyond the initially reported 8% by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if Google officially announces further layoffs beyond the initially reported 8% of its workforce by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed through official company statements or reports from at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The additional layoffs must be clearly separate from and in addition to the initially reported 8% workforce reduction. If no such additional layoffs are announced by the specified date, or if Google only provides updates or clarifications about the initially reported 8% reduction without announcing new cuts, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Will there be further job cuts from Google beyond the initially disclosed 8% by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if Google makes an official declaration regarding additional job cuts beyond the initially disclosed 8% of its workforce by August 31, 2024. The confirmation must come from official company communications or reports from at least two credible news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The new job cuts must be distinctly separate from the previously reported 8% workforce reduction. If no further job cuts are announced by the specified date, or if Google merely updates or clarifies the previously reported 8% reduction without introducing new layoffs, the inquiry will be deemed negative.

question.title: Will a major South Korean battery company begin construction of a factory in Michigan by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, construction on a large-scale lithium-ion battery factory in Michigan, owned by a South Korean company, has officially commenced. Confirmation must come from at least two of the following sources: official company announcements, statements from the Michigan state government, or reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, Bloomberg, The Wall Street Journal). The commencement of construction should involve significant on-site activities such as groundbreaking, foundation work, or major earthmoving operations. Mere preparatory activities like site clearing or permitting processes do not qualify as construction commencement. If no such construction has begun by the specified date, or if the project is officially cancelled or indefinitely postponed, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is a prominent battery manufacturer from South Korea set to start building a facility in Michigan before the end of August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with YES if, by August 31, 2024, construction of a large-scale lithium-ion battery manufacturing plant in Michigan, owned by a South Korean firm, has officially started. Verification must come from at least two of the following sources: official announcements from the company, statements from the government of Michigan, or reports from at least three major news outlets (such as the Associated Press, Reuters, Bloomberg, or The Wall Street Journal). The initiation of construction should involve substantial on-site activities like groundbreaking, foundation work, or significant earthmoving tasks. Simple preparatory actions such as clearing the site or obtaining permits do not count as the start of construction. If no construction has commenced by the specified date, or if the project is officially cancelled or postponed indefinitely, the question will be answered as NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that by August 2024, both of these events will take place: (a) Google reveals further layoffs exceeding the originally stated 8%, and (b) a prominent South Korean battery manufacturer starts building a factory in Michigan?

question.title: Will the UK economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the UK economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the UK's Office for National Statistics. The question resolves as NO if the UK economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

para_P.title: Will the UK economy steer clear of a recession by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed affirmative if, by the end of July 2024, the UK economy has not fallen into a recession. For the context of this question, a recession is characterized as two successive quarters of declining GDP growth as reported by the UK's Office for National Statistics. The inquiry will be considered negative if the UK economy undergoes two consecutive quarters of GDP decline at any time from October 1, 2023, to July 31, 2024.

question.title: Will General Motors' quarterly net income increase by over 20% year-over-year by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if General Motors reports a net income increase of more than 20% for any quarter compared to the same quarter in the previous year, in its official financial statements released by July 31, 2024. The increase must be verified through official company earnings reports or at least three credible financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal). If no such increase is reported by the resolution date, or if the highest reported increase is 20% or less, the question resolves as NO. Note that this question does not consider any specific quarter, but rather any quarter-over-quarter comparison within the specified timeframe.

para_P.title: Will General Motors see a rise in quarterly net income exceeding 20% compared to the previous year by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with YES if General Motors discloses a net income growth of more than 20% for any quarter when compared to the same quarter from the last year, as reported in its official financial disclosures by July 31, 2024. The increase must be confirmed through official earnings reports from the company or at least three reputable financial news outlets (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the Wall Street Journal). If there is no such growth reported by the resolution date, or if the highest recorded increase is 20% or lower, the inquiry will be resolved as NO. It is important to note that this question does not focus on any particular quarter but rather any quarter-over-quarter comparison within the defined period.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by July 2024: (a) The UK economy avoids a recession (b) General Motors' quarterly net income increases by over 20% year-over-year?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met by July 31, 2024: (a) The UK economy does not enter a recession, defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the UK's Office for National Statistics, between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024. (b) General Motors reports a net income increase of more than 20% for any quarter compared to the same quarter in the previous year, in its official financial statements released by July 31, 2024. para_P.title: By July 2024, will the following two events take place: (a) The UK economy successfully avoids a recession (b) General Motors experiences a quarterly net income rise exceeding 20% compared to the previous year?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with YES if both of the subsequent criteria are satisfied by July 31, 2024: (a) The UK economy remains out of a recession, which is characterized as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as indicated by the UK's Office for National Statistics, occurring between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024. (b) General Motors discloses a net income growth of over 20% for any quarter in comparison to the same quarter from the prior year, in its official financial reports published by July 31, 2024. This increase must be corroborated through official company earnings reports or at least three reliable financial news outlets (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal). If either of these conditions is not fulfilled, the resolution will be NO.

question.title: Will the Central Bank of New Zealand announce a new economic stimulus package by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the Central Bank of New Zealand officially announces a new economic stimulus package. The announcement must come from an official Central Bank of New Zealand communication channel, such as a press release or a public speech by the Governor of the Central Bank of New Zealand. The announcement should explicitly describe the new economic stimulus package. The announcement must be reported by at least two major financial news outlets (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC, Financial Times) to be considered valid. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, or if the Central Bank of New Zealand maintains the current economic policy, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that the Central Bank of New Zealand will introduce a new economic stimulus package before August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed affirmative if, by August 31, 2024, the Central Bank of New Zealand formally reveals a new economic stimulus package. The announcement must originate from an official communication channel of the Central Bank of New Zealand, such as a press release or a public address by the Governor of the Central Bank. The details of the new economic stimulus package should be clearly outlined in the announcement. Additionally, the announcement must be covered by at least two prominent financial news organizations (for instance, Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC, Financial Times) to be considered legitimate. If no such announcement occurs by the specified date, or if the Central Bank of New Zealand continues with its existing economic policy, the inquiry will be resolved as negative.

question.title: Will South Korea's KOSPI index reach or exceed 3,500 points by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, at any point between October 1, 2023 and August 31, 2024, South Korea's KOSPI index reaches or exceeds 3,500 points. The 3,500 point level is chosen as a representative value that the index might have been at before a significant drop. Verification will be based on official index reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the Korea Exchange. If the index does not reach 3,500 points during this period, the question resolves as NO. Note that intraday highs count for resolution; the index does not need to close at or above 3,500 points.

para_P.title: Is it possible for South Korea's KOSPI index to hit or surpass 3,500 points by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, at any time from October 1, 2023, to August 31, 2024, South Korea's KOSPI index reaches or exceeds the 3,500 points threshold. The 3,500 point mark is selected as an indicative value that the index may have achieved prior to a major decline. Confirmation will rely on official index reports from credible financial market data sources like Bloomberg, Reuters, or the Korea Exchange. If the index fails to reach 3,500 points within this timeframe, the inquiry will be deemed as NO. It is important to note that intraday peaks are considered for resolution; the index does not have to close at or above 3,500 points.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by August 2024: (a) The Central Bank of New Zealand announces a new economic stimulus package, and (b) South Korea's KOSPI index reaches or exceeds 3,500 points?

para_P.title: By August 2024, will the following two events take place: (a) A new economic stimulus package is announced by the Central Bank of New Zealand, and (b) South Korea's KOSPI index hits or surpasses 3,500 points?

This announcement must be disseminated through an official communication channel of the Central Bank of New Zealand, such as a press release or a public address by the Governor of the Central Bank of New Zealand. It should clearly outline the new economic stimulus package and must be covered by at least two prominent financial news organizations (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC, Financial Times). Intraday peaks are sufficient for resolution; the index does not need to finish at or above 3,500 points. If either of the conditions is unmet, the inquiry will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Texas enact new abortion regulations stricter than those for other healthcare providers by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Texas enacts new laws or regulations that impose stricter requirements on abortion providers compared to other healthcare providers. The enactment must be confirmed by official state legislative documentation or reported by at least two reputable news sources. Stricter requirements may include, but are not limited to, additional licensing, reporting, or facility standards specific to abortion providers. If no such laws or regulations are enacted by the resolution date, or if any enacted laws or regulations apply equally to all healthcare providers, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Will new abortion laws in Texas be more stringent than those applicable to other healthcare providers by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, by July 31, 2024, Texas implements new legislation or regulations that create more stringent requirements for abortion providers in comparison to other healthcare providers. The implementation must be verified through official state legislative records or reported by at least two credible news organizations. More stringent requirements may encompass, but are not limited to, additional licensing, reporting, or facility standards that are specific to abortion providers. If no such legislation or regulations are put in place by the resolution date, or if any laws or regulations enacted are uniformly applied to all healthcare providers, the question will be answered as NO.

question.title: Will Alabama hold a referendum on abortion rights by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Alabama officially conducts a statewide referendum specifically on the topic of abortion rights. The referendum must be related to enshrining abortion rights in the state constitution or significantly altering existing abortion laws. For a YES resolution, the referendum must be officially announced by the Alabama state government and the voting process must be completed by the resolution date. The occurrence and results of the referendum must be reported by at least two major, reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or major national newspapers). If no such referendum is held or completed by July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that merely scheduling a future referendum beyond the resolution date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

para_P.title: Will Alabama conduct a vote on abortion rights before July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, by July 31, 2024, Alabama officially carries out a statewide vote specifically concerning abortion rights. The vote must pertain to the establishment of abortion rights in the state constitution or a significant modification of current abortion legislation. For a YES outcome, the vote must be officially declared by the Alabama state government, and the electoral process must be finalized by the resolution date. The occurrence and results of the vote must be reported by at least two prominent, credible news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or major national newspapers). If no such vote is held or completed by July 31, 2024, the inquiry will resolve as NO. It is important to note that simply planning a future vote beyond the resolution date does not qualify for a YES outcome.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by July 2024: (a) Texas enacts new abortion regulations stricter than those for other healthcare providers, and (b) Alabama holds a referendum on abortion rights?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met by July 31, 2024: (a) Texas enacts new laws or regulations that impose stricter requirements on abortion providers compared to other healthcare providers. The enactment must be confirmed by official state legislative documentation or reported by at least two reputable news sources. Stricter requirements may include, but are not limited to, additional licensing, reporting, or facility standards specific to abortion providers. If no such laws or regulations are enacted by the resolution date, or if any enacted laws or regulations apply equally to all healthcare providers, this condition is not met. (b) Alabama officially conducts a statewide referendum specifically on the topic of abortion rights. The referendum must be related to enshrining abortion rights in the state constitution or significantly altering existing abortion laws. For this condition to be met, the referendum must be officially announced by the Alabama state government and the voting process must be completed by the resolution date. The occurrence and results of the referendum must be reported by at least two major, reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or major national newspapers). If no such referendum is held or completed by July 31, 2024, this condition is not met. If both conditions are met, the question resolves as YES; otherwise, it resolves as NO.

para_P.title: By July 2024, will the following events take place: (a) Texas introduces new abortion laws that are more stringent than those for other medical providers, and (b) Alabama organizes a vote on abortion rights?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if both of the subsequent circumstances are fulfilled by July 31, 2024: (a) Texas implements new statutes or regulations that set forth stricter criteria for abortion providers than for other medical providers. This implementation must be validated by official state legislative documents or reported by at least two credible news outlets. Stricter criteria may encompass, but are not limited to, enhanced licensing, reporting, or facility standards unique to abortion providers. The vote must pertain to either securing abortion rights in the state constitution or making significant changes to existing abortion laws. For this condition to be satisfied, the vote must be formally announced by the Alabama state government and the voting process must be finalized by the resolution date. The occurrence and outcomes of the vote must be reported by at least two prominent, trustworthy news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or major national newspapers). If no such vote is conducted or finalized by July 31, 2024, this condition is not satisfied. If both conditions are fulfilled, the question resolves as YES; otherwise, it resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Union Pacific implement a new scheduling system for train engineers in Texas by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Union Pacific Railroad announces and implements a new scheduling system aimed at making schedules more predictable for train engineers operating in Texas. The implementation must be confirmed through official company statements or reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The new system must be specifically designed to address the quality of life concerns related to schedule predictability for train engineers in Texas. If no such system is implemented and confirmed by the resolution date, or if the implemented system does not specifically target schedule predictability for engineers in Texas, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Is Union Pacific going to roll out a new scheduling system for train engineers in Texas before August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered TRUE if, by August 31, 2024, Union Pacific Railroad declares and puts into action a new scheduling system intended to enhance the predictability of schedules for train engineers working in Texas. This implementation must be verified through official statements from the company or reported by at least two credible news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The new system must be specifically crafted to tackle the quality of life issues associated with schedule predictability for train engineers in Texas. If such a system is not implemented and confirmed by the resolution date, or if the system that is implemented does not specifically focus on improving schedule predictability for engineers in Texas, the inquiry will be deemed FALSE.

question.title: Will Union Pacific implement a new scheduling system for passenger train services by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Union Pacific Railroad announces and implements a new scheduling system aimed at making schedules more predictable for passenger train services. The implementation must be confirmed through official company statements or reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The new system must be specifically designed to address the quality of life concerns related to schedule predictability for passenger train services. If no such system is implemented and confirmed by the resolution date, or if the implemented system does not specifically target schedule predictability for passenger train services, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Will Union Pacific introduce a new timetable system for passenger trains by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if, by August 31, 2024, Union Pacific Railroad reveals and puts into action a new timetable system intended to enhance the predictability of schedules for passenger train services. The implementation must be validated through official announcements from the company or reported by at least two credible news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The new system should be specifically aimed at improving the quality of life issues related to schedule reliability for passenger train services. If no such system is launched and verified by the resolution date, or if the system that is implemented does not specifically focus on schedule reliability for passenger train services, the inquiry will be deemed negative.

question.title: Will Union Pacific implement new scheduling systems for both train engineers in Texas and passenger train services by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Union Pacific Railroad announces and implements new scheduling systems aimed at making schedules more predictable for both train engineers operating in Texas and passenger train services. The implementation for both systems must be confirmed through official company statements or reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). Each new system must be specifically designed to address the quality of life concerns related to schedule predictability: one for train engineers in Texas and the other for passenger train services. If either system is not implemented and confirmed by the resolution date, or if either implemented system does not specifically target schedule predictability for its respective group, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Will Union Pacific introduce new scheduling systems for train operators in Texas and for passenger train services by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered YES if, by August 31, 2024, Union Pacific Railroad announces and puts into action new scheduling systems intended to enhance predictability for both train operators in Texas and passenger train services. The confirmation of the implementation for both systems must come from official statements by the company or be reported by at least two credible news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). Each new system must specifically aim to address quality of life issues related to schedule predictability: one for train operators in Texas and the other for passenger train services. If either system is not implemented and confirmed by the resolution date, or if either implemented system does not specifically focus on schedule predictability for its respective group, the inquiry will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will the U.S. government resume consideration of liquefied natural gas export projects by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the U.S. federal government has officially resumed the consideration of projects aimed at exporting liquefied natural gas (LNG). The resumption must be confirmed through official government announcements or reports from at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or The Wall Street Journal). The resumption should involve the active processing or review of LNG export project applications by relevant federal agencies. If no such resumption occurs by the resolution date, or if the pause on consideration remains in effect, the question resolves as NO. Note that this question does not require the approval of any specific projects, only the resumption of the consideration process.

para_P.title: Will the U.S. federal government restart the evaluation of liquefied natural gas export initiatives by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with YES if, by July 31, 2024, the U.S. federal government has officially restarted the evaluation of initiatives related to the export of liquefied natural gas (LNG). The restart must be verified through official government communications or reports from at least two credible news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or The Wall Street Journal). The restart should involve the active handling or assessment of LNG export initiative applications by the appropriate federal agencies. If no such restart occurs by the resolution date, or if the halt on evaluation remains in place, the inquiry will be answered with NO. It is important to note that this question does not necessitate the approval of any particular initiatives, only the resumption of the evaluation process.

question.title: Will BYD's quarterly net income increase by over 20% year-over-year by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if BYD reports a net income increase of more than 20% for any quarter compared to the same quarter in the previous year, in its official financial statements released by July 31, 2024. The increase must be verified through official company earnings reports or at least three credible financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal). If no such increase is reported by the resolution date, or if the highest reported increase is 20% or less, the question resolves as NO. Note that this question does not consider any specific quarter, but rather any quarter-over-quarter comparison within the specified timeframe.

para_P.title: Is it projected that BYD's net earnings for a quarter will rise by more than 20% compared to the same quarter from the previous year by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if BYD's financial disclosures indicate a net earnings growth exceeding 20% for any quarter in comparison to the corresponding quarter from the prior year, as reported in their official financial statements by July 31, 2024. The growth must be substantiated through official company earnings announcements or at least three reputable financial news outlets (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal). If there is no reported growth by the resolution deadline, or if the maximum reported growth is 20% or less, the inquiry will be answered with a NO. It is important to note that this question encompasses any quarter-over-quarter comparison within the designated period, rather than focusing on a specific quarter.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by July 2024: (1) The U.S. government resumes consideration of liquefied natural gas export projects, and (2) BYD's quarterly net income increases by over 20% year-over-year?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met by July 31, 2024: (1) The U.S. federal government officially resumes the consideration of projects aimed at exporting liquefied natural gas (LNG). This resumption must be confirmed through official government announcements or reports from at least two reputable news sources such as Reuters, Associated Press, or The Wall Street Journal. The resumption should involve the active processing or review of LNG export project applications by relevant federal agencies. (2) BYD reports a net income increase of more than 20% for any quarter compared to the same quarter in the previous year, in its official financial statements released by July 31, 2024. This increase must be verified through official company earnings reports or at least three credible financial news sources like Bloomberg, Reuters, or Wall Street Journal. If either condition is not met by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: By July 2024, will both of these events take place: (1) The U.S. government recommences its evaluation of liquefied natural gas export initiatives, and (2) will BYD's quarterly net earnings rise by more than 20% compared to the previous year?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with YES if both of the following events occur by July 31, 2024: (1) The U.S. federal government officially starts to reconsider projects related to the export of liquefied natural gas (LNG). This restart must be substantiated by official government communications or reports from at least two trusted news outlets such as Reuters, Associated Press, or The Wall Street Journal. The resumption should include the active processing or assessment of LNG export project proposals by the appropriate federal authorities. (2) BYD must disclose a net income growth exceeding 20% for any quarter in comparison to the same quarter from the previous year, in its official financial disclosures released by July 31, 2024. This increase must be confirmed through official company earnings reports or at least three reliable financial news sources like Bloomberg, Reuters, or Wall Street Journal. If either of these conditions is not satisfied by the resolution date, the question will be answered as NO.

question.title: Will Georgia hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Georgia officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a positive resolution:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the Georgia state government.
2. The referendum must explicitly address the issue of abortion rights protection.
3. The results of the referendum must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

The question will resolve as NO if:

1. No such referendum occurs by August 31, 2024.
2. A planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond the specified date.
3. A referendum is held, but it does not specifically focus on enshrining protection for abortion rights.

Note: This question does not consider the outcome of the referendum, only whether it takes place within the specified timeframe.

para_P.title: Will there be a public vote in Georgia regarding abortion rights before August 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, by August 31, 2024, Georgia officially carries out a public vote aimed at establishing legal protections for abortion rights within the state. For a positive outcome:

1. The vote must be officially declared and executed by the Georgia state authorities.
2. The vote must directly pertain to the matter of safeguarding abortion rights.
3. The outcomes of the vote must be made public through official state communications or through widely acknowledged news outlets.

The answer will be NO if:

1. No such public vote takes place by August 31, 2024.
2. An anticipated vote is cancelled or delayed beyond the given date.
3. A vote occurs, but it does not specifically address the establishment of protections for abortion rights.

Note: This question is solely concerned with whether the vote occurs within the designated timeframe, without regard to the vote's results.

question.title: Will the FTC announce completion of a major pricing practices investigation by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Federal Trade Commission (FTC) officially announces the completion of its investigation into pricing practices that use personal data to set prices based on individual shopper characteristics. The investigation must involve at least five major companies. Completion must be confirmed through an official FTC announcement or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, or New York Times). If the FTC does not announce the completion of such an investigation by this date, or if the investigation is still ongoing, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will the FTC declare the conclusion of a significant inquiry into pricing practices before July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Federal Trade Commission (FTC) publicly declares that it has completed its investigation into pricing strategies that utilize personal data to determine prices based on the characteristics of individual shoppers. The investigation must encompass at least five prominent companies. The conclusion must be validated through an official announcement from the FTC or reported by a minimum of two major news organizations (such as Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, or New York Times). If the FTC fails to announce the conclusion of such an investigation by this date, or if the investigation remains active, the question will be answered with NO.

question.title: Will Georgia hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024 and will the FTC complete a major pricing practices investigation by July 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following occur:

(a) By August 31, 2024, Georgia officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a positive resolution:
   1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the Georgia state government.
   2. The referendum must explicitly address the issue of abortion rights protection.
   3. The results of the referendum must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.
   The question will resolve as NO if:
   1. No such referendum occurs by August 31, 2024.
   2. A planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond the specified date.
   3. A referendum is held, but it does not specifically focus on enshrining protection for abortion rights.
   Note: This question does not consider the outcome of the referendum, only whether it takes place within the specified timeframe.

(b) By July 31, 2024, the Federal Trade Commission (FTC) officially announces the completion of its investigation into pricing practices that use personal data to set prices based on individual shopper characteristics. The investigation must involve at least five major companies. Completion must be confirmed through an official FTC announcement or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, or New York Times). If the FTC does not announce the completion of such an investigation by this date, or if the investigation is still ongoing, the question resolves as NO.

For this combined question to resolve as YES, both conditions (a) and (b) must be satisfied within their respective timeframes.

para_P.title: Is there a plan for Georgia to conduct a referendum regarding abortion rights before August 2024, and will the FTC finalize a significant investigation into pricing practices by July 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered YES if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) By August 31, 2024, Georgia officially holds a public referendum aimed at establishing protection for abortion rights within the state. For a positive outcome:
   1. The referendum must be officially declared and executed by the Georgia state authorities.
   2. The referendum must clearly focus on the matter of safeguarding abortion rights.
   3. The results of the referendum must be publicly disclosed by official state agencies or widely recognized news organizations.
   The inquiry will be deemed NO if:
   1. No such referendum takes place by August 31, 2024.
   2. A scheduled referendum is cancelled or delayed beyond the specified date.
   3. A referendum occurs, but it does not specifically aim at establishing protection for abortion rights.
   Note: This inquiry does not take into account the outcome of the referendum, only whether it is conducted within the designated timeframe.

(b) By July 31, 2024, the Federal Trade Commission (FTC) officially declares the conclusion of its investigation into pricing practices that utilize personal data to adjust prices based on individual shopper traits. The investigation must involve no fewer than five significant companies. The completion must be validated through an official announcement from the FTC or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, or New York Times). If the FTC fails to announce the conclusion of such an investigation by this date, or if the investigation is still in progress, the inquiry resolves as NO.

For this combined inquiry to resolve as YES, both conditions (a) and (b) must be fulfilled within their respective timeframes.

question.title: Will the average rate on a 15-year mortgage exceed 5.5% by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, at any point during August 2024, the average rate on a 15-year fixed-rate mortgage, as reported by Freddie Mac in its Primary Mortgage Market Survey, exceeds 5.5%. The rate must be confirmed by official reports from Freddie Mac or reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or The Wall Street Journal. If the rate does not exceed 5.5% at any point during August 2024, the question resolves as NO. For clarity, the rate must surpass 5.5%, not merely equal it.

para_P.title: Will the typical interest rate for a 15-year mortgage go beyond 5.5% by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered YES if, at any time throughout August 2024, the typical interest rate for a 15-year fixed mortgage, as documented by Freddie Mac in its Primary Mortgage Market Survey, goes beyond 5.5%. The rate must be validated by official reports from Freddie Mac or credible financial news outlets like Bloomberg, Reuters, or The Wall Street Journal. If the rate does not surpass 5.5% at any time during August 2024, the question will be answered as NO. To clarify, the rate must exceed 5.5%, not just match it.

question.title: Will PepsiCo report increased North American demand for its Cracker Jack brand by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, PepsiCo reports an increase in North American demand for its Cracker Jack brand compared to the demand reported in the second quarter of 2023. The increase must be confirmed through official company earnings reports or statements from PepsiCo and reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The demand increase should be explicitly stated or clearly implied in the company's financial results or official communications. If no such increase is reported by the specified date, or if PepsiCo reports continued decline or stagnation in demand for Cracker Jack in North America, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that PepsiCo will announce a rise in North American interest in its Cracker Jack brand by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if, by July 31, 2024, PepsiCo discloses an uptick in North American interest for its Cracker Jack brand in comparison to the demand noted in the second quarter of 2023. The increase must be validated through official earnings reports or statements from PepsiCo and covered by at least two credible news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The rise in demand should be clearly articulated or strongly suggested in the company’s financial disclosures or official announcements. If no such increase is reported by the designated date, or if PepsiCo indicates a persistent decline or stagnation in demand for Cracker Jack in North America, the inquiry will be deemed negative.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The average rate on a 15-year mortgage exceeds 5.5% by August 2024 (b) PepsiCo reports increased North American demand for its Cracker Jack brand by July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met:

The rate must surpass 5.5%, not merely equal it.
(b) By July 31, 2024, PepsiCo reports an increase in North American demand for its Cracker Jack brand compared to the demand reported in the second quarter of 2023. The increase must be confirmed through official company earnings reports or statements from PepsiCo and reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The demand increase should be explicitly stated or clearly implied in the company's financial results or official communications.
If either of these conditions is not met, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) The average interest rate on a 15-year mortgage will be over 5.5% by August 2024 (b) PepsiCo will announce a rise in North American demand for its Cracker Jack brand by July 2024?
para_P.body:

The rate must exceed 5.5%, not just meet it.

The rise in demand should be clearly stated or strongly suggested in the company's financial results or official communications.

question.title: Will Pennsylvania conduct a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of Pennsylvania.
2. The primary focus of the referendum must be on abortion rights protection.
3. The referendum results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

If no such referendum meeting these criteria occurs by August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that merely proposing or planning a referendum without actually conducting it by the specified date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

para_P.title: Is Pennsylvania set to hold a vote on abortion rights before August 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, by August 31, 2024, Pennsylvania carries out a public vote specifically aimed at establishing protections for abortion rights within the state. For a YES outcome, the following conditions must be satisfied:
