3. The results of the vote must be disclosed through official state channels or reputable news outlets.

If no such vote that meets these conditions takes place by August 31, 2024, the question will be answered with a NO. It is important to note that simply suggesting or planning a vote without actually holding it by the specified date does not meet the criteria for a YES outcome.

question.title: Will Missouri remove the work requirement from its Medicaid plan by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the state of Missouri officially announces the removal of the work requirement from its Medicaid plan. The change must be confirmed through official state announcements or reported by at least two major news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The work requirement refers to the condition that beneficiaries must work or engage in other qualifying activities to receive Medicaid benefits. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, or if the work requirement remains in place, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will the state of Missouri eliminate the employment requirement from its Medicaid program by the end of July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a YES if, by July 31, 2024, Missouri's government publicly declares the abolishment of the employment requirement from its Medicaid program. This modification must be verified through official state communications or reported by a minimum of two prominent news outlets (including Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The employment requirement pertains to the stipulation that recipients must work or participate in other qualifying activities to obtain Medicaid benefits. If no such declaration is made by the specified resolution date, or if the employment requirement continues to be enforced, the inquiry will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Pennsylvania conducts a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024 and (b) Missouri removes the work requirement from its Medicaid plan by July 2024?

This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met:

If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, or if the work requirement remains in place, the question resolves as NO.

If both (a) and (b) occur by their respective dates, this question resolves as YES. Otherwise, it resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) Pennsylvania will hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024 and (b) Missouri will eliminate the work requirement from its Medicaid program by July 2024?

If no such declaration is made by the resolution date, or if the work requirement continues to exist, the question resolves as NO.

If both (a) and (b) occur by their respective deadlines, this question will resolve as YES. If not, it will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Spotify announce additional layoffs beyond the initially reported 2% by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if Spotify officially announces further layoffs beyond the initially reported 2% of its workforce by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed through official company statements or reports from at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The additional layoffs must be clearly separate from and in addition to the initially reported 2% workforce reduction. If no such additional layoffs are announced by the specified date, or if Spotify only provides updates or clarifications about the initially reported 2% reduction without announcing new cuts, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Will there be any further layoffs at Spotify beyond the initially disclosed 2% before August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed TRUE if Spotify makes an official declaration regarding additional layoffs exceeding the initially disclosed 2% of its staff by August 31, 2024. The confirmation must come from official company announcements or reports from at least two credible news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The new layoffs must be distinctly separate from the previously reported 2% workforce cut. If no further layoffs are announced by the deadline, or if Spotify only offers updates or clarifications regarding the initially reported 2% reduction without revealing new layoffs, the inquiry will be regarded as FALSE.

question.title: Will the Reserve Bank of India announce a reduction in its key interest rate by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Reserve Bank of India publicly announces a reduction in its key interest rate by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be officially made by the Reserve Bank of India and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC. The reduction must be in the repo rate, which is the RBI's primary tool for influencing the economy. A mere hint or speculation about future rate cuts does not qualify; there must be a concrete announcement of an actual rate reduction. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will the Reserve Bank of India make a public statement about lowering its main interest rate before August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if the Reserve Bank of India officially declares a decrease in its main interest rate by August 31, 2024. The declaration must be made by the Reserve Bank of India and reported by a minimum of two credible financial news outlets such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC. The reduction must pertain to the repo rate, which is the primary mechanism the RBI uses to impact the economy. Merely suggesting or speculating about potential rate cuts does not meet the criteria; there must be a definitive announcement of an actual rate decrease. If no such declaration occurs by the designated date, the inquiry will be deemed negative.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by August 2024: (1) Spotify announces additional layoffs beyond the initially reported 2%, and (2) The Reserve Bank of India announces a reduction in its key interest rate?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met by August 31, 2024: (1) Spotify officially announces further layoffs beyond the initially reported 2% of its workforce. The announcement must be confirmed through official company statements or reports from at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). (2) The Reserve Bank of India publicly announces a reduction in its key interest rate. The announcement must be officially made by the Reserve Bank of India and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC. The reduction must be in the repo rate, which is the RBI's primary tool for influencing the economy. A mere hint or speculation about future rate cuts does not qualify; there must be a concrete announcement of an actual rate reduction. If either of these announcements is not made by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: By August 2024, will the following two events take place: (1) Spotify reveals further layoffs exceeding the initially disclosed 2%, and (2) The Reserve Bank of India declares a decrease in its main interest rate?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if both of the subsequent conditions are fulfilled by August 31, 2024: (1) Spotify officially discloses additional layoffs that go beyond the previously announced 2% of its staff. This announcement must be validated through formal company communications or reports from at least two credible news outlets (like Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). These further layoffs must be distinctly separate from the initially reported 2% workforce cut. (2) The Reserve Bank of India publicly states a reduction in its main interest rate. This declaration must be made officially by the Reserve Bank of India and covered by at least two reliable financial news organizations such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC. The reduction must pertain to the repo rate, which is the RBI's fundamental mechanism for impacting the economy. A mere suggestion or speculation regarding potential rate cuts does not meet the criteria; there must be a definitive announcement of an actual rate decrease. If either of these statements is not issued by the designated date, the outcome will be negative.

question.title: Will the Bank of England announce an interest rate cut by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Bank of England officially announces an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed by official Bank of England communications, such as press releases, Monetary Policy Committee statements, or public speeches by Bank officials. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. Note that the actual implementation date of the rate cut can be after August 31, 2024, as long as the announcement itself occurs by that date. The interest rate in question refers to the Bank Rate, which is the Bank of England's primary tool for monetary policy.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that the Bank of England will declare a reduction in interest rates before August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be resolved in the affirmative if the Bank of England makes an official declaration regarding a reduction in interest rates that is set to take effect by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be validated through official communications from the Bank of England, such as press releases, statements from the Monetary Policy Committee, or public addresses by Bank officials. If no such declaration is made by the specified resolution date, the inquiry will be resolved in the negative. It is important to note that the actual date of implementation for the rate reduction may occur after August 31, 2024, as long as the announcement itself is made by that date. The interest rate in question pertains to the Bank Rate, which serves as the primary instrument for the Bank of England's monetary policy.

question.title: Will GNC Holdings emerge from bankruptcy by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, GNC Holdings officially emerges from its Chapter 11 bankruptcy proceedings. The emergence must be confirmed by at least two reputable financial news outlets (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, or CNBC) or through official company statements or court documents. The emergence should involve a court-approved reorganization plan that allows GNC Holdings to continue operations with a restructured financial position. If GNC Holdings remains in bankruptcy proceedings, is liquidated, or fails to emerge from bankruptcy by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will GNC Holdings successfully exit bankruptcy by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if, by July 31, 2024, GNC Holdings officially exits its Chapter 11 bankruptcy process. Confirmation must come from at least two credible financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, or CNBC) or through official announcements from the company or court documents. The exit should include a court-sanctioned reorganization plan that permits GNC Holdings to operate with a restructured financial framework. If GNC Holdings remains in bankruptcy, is liquidated, or does not exit bankruptcy by the given date, the inquiry will be deemed negative.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The Bank of England announces an interest rate cut by August 2024 (b) GNC Holdings emerges from bankruptcy by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met: (a) The Bank of England officially announces an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed by official Bank of England communications, such as press releases, Monetary Policy Committee statements, or public speeches by Bank officials. Note that the actual implementation date of the rate cut can be after August 31, 2024, as long as the announcement itself occurs by that date. The interest rate in question refers to the Bank Rate, which is the Bank of England's primary tool for monetary policy. (b) GNC Holdings officially emerges from its Chapter 11 bankruptcy proceedings by July 31, 2024. The emergence must be confirmed by at least two reputable financial news outlets (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, or CNBC) or through official company statements or court documents. The emergence should involve a court-approved reorganization plan that allows GNC Holdings to continue operations with a restructured financial position. If GNC Holdings remains in bankruptcy proceedings, is liquidated, or fails to emerge from bankruptcy by the specified date, the question resolves as NO. If both conditions are not met, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) The Bank of England will declare a reduction in interest rates by August 2024 (b) GNC Holdings will successfully exit bankruptcy by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered TRUE if both of the subsequent criteria are satisfied: (a) The Bank of England makes an official declaration regarding a reduction in the interest rate to take effect by August 31, 2024. This declaration must be validated by official communications from the Bank of England, which may include press releases, statements from the Monetary Policy Committee, or public addresses by Bank officials. It is important to note that the actual date when the rate cut is implemented can occur after August 31, 2024, provided that the announcement itself is made by that date. The interest rate in question pertains to the Bank Rate, which serves as the primary instrument for monetary policy by the Bank of England. (b) GNC Holdings officially exits its Chapter 11 bankruptcy process by July 31, 2024. This exit must be confirmed by at least two credible financial news organizations (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, or CNBC) or through official statements from the company or court documents. The exit should involve a court-sanctioned reorganization plan that permits GNC Holdings to continue its operations with a revised financial structure. If GNC Holdings remains in bankruptcy proceedings, is liquidated, or does not exit bankruptcy by the specified date, the inquiry resolves as FALSE. If both criteria are not fulfilled, the inquiry resolves as FALSE.

question.title: Will the Italian economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Italian economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the Italian National Institute of Statistics. The question resolves as NO if the Italian economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

para_P.title: Can the Italian economy steer clear of a recession before July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if, by July 31, 2024, the Italian economy has not entered a recession. For the context of this question, a recession is characterized by two successive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the Italian National Institute of Statistics. The inquiry will be deemed negative if the Italian economy undergoes two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any time from October 1, 2023, to July 31, 2024.

question.title: Will the Federal Reserve's preferred inflation measure show a monthly increase exceeding 0.5% by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Federal Reserve's preferred inflation measure (typically the Personal Consumption Expenditures Price Index or PCE) reports a month-over-month increase greater than 0.5% in any single month between October 2023 and July 31, 2024. The increase must be officially published by the Federal Reserve or a relevant U.S. government agency (such as the Bureau of Economic Analysis) and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC). If no such increase is reported during this period, the question will resolve as NO. Note that this question focuses on the month-over-month change, not year-over-year or any other time frame.

para_P.title: By July 2024, will the inflation metric favored by the Federal Reserve exhibit a monthly rise greater than 0.5%?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if the inflation metric favored by the Federal Reserve (usually the Personal Consumption Expenditures Price Index or PCE) indicates a month-over-month rise exceeding 0.5% in any month from October 2023 to July 31, 2024. The rise must be officially reported by the Federal Reserve or another relevant U.S. government body (like the Bureau of Economic Analysis) and covered by at least two credible financial news outlets (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC). If no such rise is documented during this timeframe, the answer will be NO. Please note that this question is concerned with the month-over-month variation, not year-over-year or any other duration.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by July 2024: (a) The Italian economy avoids a recession, and (b) The Federal Reserve's preferred inflation measure shows a monthly increase exceeding 0.5%?
question.body: (a) The Italian economy avoids a recession by July 31, 2024, meaning it does not experience two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the Italian National Institute of Statistics between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024. (b) The Federal Reserve's preferred inflation measure, typically the Personal Consumption Expenditures Price Index (PCE), shows a month-over-month increase greater than 0.5% in any single month between October 2023 and July 31, 2024. This increase must be officially published by the Federal Reserve or a relevant U.S. government agency and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources, such as Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, or CNBC.

para_P.title: By July 2024, will both of the following take place: (a) The Italian economy successfully steers clear of a recession, and (b) The inflation measure preferred by the Federal Reserve indicates a monthly rise surpassing 0.5%?
para_P.body: (a) The Italian economy successfully avoids a recession by July 31, 2024, meaning it does not undergo two successive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the Italian National Institute of Statistics from October 1, 2023, to July 31, 2024. (b) The inflation measure favored by the Federal Reserve, usually the Personal Consumption Expenditures Price Index (PCE), records a month-over-month increase exceeding 0.5% in any individual month between October 2023 and July 31, 2024. This increase must be officially reported by the Federal Reserve or a relevant U.S. government agency and covered by at least two credible financial news outlets, such as Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, or CNBC.

question.title: Will France appoint a new President by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, a new President is officially appointed in France. The appointment must be confirmed by official government announcements or reported by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Al Jazeera). For the purpose of this question, a 'new' President refers to an individual who is not currently serving in this role as of October 1, 2023. If no new President is appointed by the resolution date, or if the current President as of October 1, 2023, remains in office, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will a new President be appointed in France before August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as YES if, by August 31, 2024, an individual is officially designated as the new President of France. The appointment must be validated by official government communications or reported by at least two credible international news outlets (like Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Al Jazeera). For the purposes of this inquiry, a 'new' President is defined as someone who is not currently in this position as of October 1, 2023. If there is no new President appointed by the resolution date, or if the existing President as of October 1, 2023, continues in office, the inquiry resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the Bank of England's base rate remain at or above 5.00% in August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Bank of England's base rate is reported to be at or above 5.00% at any point during August 2024. Confirmation must come from official Bank of England announcements or at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, The Guardian). If the rate is reported to have decreased below 5.00% and remains below this level throughout August 2024, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will the base rate set by the Bank of England stay at or exceed 5.00% in August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as YES if it is reported that the Bank of England's base rate is at or exceeds 5.00% at any time during August 2024. Verification must come from official announcements from the Bank of England or at least two credible financial news outlets (for example, Bloomberg, Reuters, The Guardian). If the rate is reported to have fallen below 5.00% and stays below this threshold for the entirety of August 2024, the inquiry will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) France appoints a new President by August 2024, and (b) the Bank of England's base rate remains at or above 5.00% in August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met: (a) By August 31, 2024, a new President is officially appointed in France. The appointment must be confirmed by official government announcements or reported by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Al Jazeera). A 'new' President refers to an individual who is not currently serving in this role as of October 1, 2023. (b) The Bank of England's base rate is reported to be at or above 5.00% at any point during August 2024. Confirmation must come from official Bank of England announcements or at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, The Guardian). If both conditions are not met, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is it true that: (a) by August 2024, France will have a new President, and (b) the Bank of England's base interest rate will be at least 5.00% during that same month?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if both of the following criteria are fulfilled: (a) A new President is officially designated in France by August 31, 2024. This designation must be validated through official government communications or covered by a minimum of two credible international news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Al Jazeera). A 'new' President is defined as someone who is not currently in office as of October 1, 2023. (b) The Bank of England's base interest rate is noted to be at or exceeding 5.00% at any time during August 2024. Verification must come from official announcements by the Bank of England or at least two reliable financial news organizations (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, The Guardian). If either of these criteria is not satisfied, the inquiry will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will the United Kingdom's House of Lords pass a major economic reform bill opposed by Prime Minister Sunak by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the United Kingdom's House of Lords passes a major economic reform bill that is explicitly opposed by Prime Minister Rishi Sunak or his administration. To qualify:

1. The bill must be related to economic policy, such as fiscal spending, taxation, or monetary policy.
2. It must be passed by the House of Lords, regardless of whether it becomes law.
3. The opposition from Prime Minister Sunak or his administration must be clearly reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
4. The bill must be described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the UK economy.

If no such bill is passed by the House of Lords by August 31, 2024, or if a bill is passed but does not meet all the above criteria, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will the House of Lords in the United Kingdom approve a significant economic reform bill that Prime Minister Sunak is against by August 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered YES if, by August 31, 2024, the House of Lords in the United Kingdom approves a significant economic reform bill that is explicitly opposed by Prime Minister Rishi Sunak or his administration. To be valid:

1. The bill must pertain to economic policy, including fiscal spending, taxation, or monetary policy.
2. It must be approved by the House of Lords, irrespective of whether it becomes law.
3. The opposition from Prime Minister Sunak or his administration must be clearly reported by at least two major international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
4. The bill must be characterized as 'major' or 'significant' by these news outlets regarding its potential effect on the UK economy.

If no such bill is approved by the House of Lords by August 31, 2024, or if a bill is approved but does not fulfill all of the above criteria, the inquiry will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Apple finalize a union contract with store employees in Ohio by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Apple has finalized and officially signed a collective bargaining contract with the unionized store employees in Ohio. Confirmation must come from official announcements by Apple, the International Association of Machinists and Aerospace Workers' Coalition of Organized Retail Employees, or be reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers). The contract must be the first of its kind for Apple in the United States. If no such finalization and signing of the contract occurs by the specified date, or if the contract is still in a tentative or non-finalized state, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will Apple reach a collective agreement with its retail staff in Ohio before July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, by July 31, 2024, Apple has completed and officially endorsed a collective bargaining agreement with the unionized retail staff in Ohio. Verification must be provided through official statements from Apple, the International Association of Machinists and Aerospace Workers' Coalition of Organized Retail Employees, or reported by at least two credible news organizations (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers). This agreement must be the first of its kind for Apple in the United States. If there is no such completion and endorsement of the agreement by the deadline, or if the agreement remains tentative or unfinalized, the inquiry will be answered with a NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The United Kingdom's House of Lords passes a major economic reform bill opposed by Prime Minister Sunak by August 2024, and (b) Apple finalizes a union contract with store employees in Ohio by July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if both of the following occur:

(a) By August 31, 2024, the United Kingdom's House of Lords passes a major economic reform bill that is explicitly opposed by Prime Minister Rishi Sunak or his administration. To qualify:
   1. The bill must be related to economic policy, such as fiscal spending, taxation, or monetary policy.
   2. It must be passed by the House of Lords, regardless of whether it becomes law.
   3. The opposition from Prime Minister Sunak or his administration must be clearly reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
   4. The bill must be described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the UK economy.

(b) By July 31, 2024, Apple has finalized and officially signed a collective bargaining contract with the unionized store employees in Ohio. Confirmation must come from official announcements by Apple, the International Association of Machinists and Aerospace Workers' Coalition of Organized Retail Employees, or be reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers). The contract must be the first of its kind for Apple in the United States.

If either (a) or (b) does not occur by the specified dates, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (a) The House of Lords in the United Kingdom approves a significant economic reform bill that Prime Minister Sunak opposes by August 2024, and (b) Apple completes a union contract with its store employees in Ohio by July 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with YES if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) By August 31, 2024, the House of Lords in the United Kingdom must pass a significant economic reform bill that is clearly opposed by Prime Minister Rishi Sunak or his government. For this to qualify:
   1. The legislation must pertain to economic matters, including fiscal expenditure, taxation, or monetary policy.
   2. It must be approved by the House of Lords, irrespective of whether it becomes law.
   3. The opposition from Prime Minister Sunak or his government must be explicitly reported by at least two leading international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
   4. The bill must be characterized as 'major' or 'significant' by these news outlets concerning its potential effects on the UK economy.

(b) By July 31, 2024, Apple must have finalized and officially signed a collective bargaining agreement with the unionized employees at its stores in Ohio. Verification must come from official statements by Apple, the International Association of Machinists and Aerospace Workers' Coalition of Organized Retail Employees, or be reported by at least two credible news organizations (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers). This contract must be the first of its kind for Apple within the United States.

If either (a) or (b) fails to occur by the outlined deadlines, the answer will be NO.

question.title: Will Elon Musk conduct a live interview with Sergey Brin on X by August 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if Elon Musk conducts a live interview with Sergey Brin on X (formerly known as Twitter) by August 31, 2024. For a positive resolution, the following criteria must be met:

1. The interview must be conducted live on the X platform.
2. Elon Musk must be the primary interviewer.
3. Sergey Brin must be the interviewee.
4. The event must be officially announced by X or Elon Musk prior to its occurrence.
5. The interview must be publicly accessible on the X platform.
6. At least two major news outlets (such as CNN, Fox News, MSNBC, Reuters, or Associated Press) must report on the event either before or after it takes place.

If all these conditions are met by August 31, 2024, the question resolves as YES. If any of these conditions are not met by this date, or if the interview does not occur, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will Elon Musk host a live discussion with Sergey Brin on X before August 2024?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with YES if Elon Musk hosts a live discussion with Sergey Brin on X (previously known as Twitter) by August 31, 2024. For a positive answer, the following conditions must be satisfied:

1. The discussion must be held live on the X platform.
2. Elon Musk must take on the role of the main interviewer.
3. Sergey Brin must participate as the interviewee.
4. The event must be officially announced by X or Elon Musk ahead of its occurrence.
5. The discussion must be available to the public on the X platform.
6. A minimum of two prominent news organizations (like CNN, Fox News, MSNBC, Reuters, or Associated Press) must cover the event either prior to or following its occurrence.

If all these criteria are fulfilled by August 31, 2024, the question will be answered with YES. If any of these criteria are not fulfilled by this date, or if the discussion does not take place, the question will be answered with NO.

question.title: Will the United States implement a significant tariff on Chinese-made electric vehicles by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the United States officially implements a tariff of 50% or higher on imports of Chinese-made electric vehicles. The implementation must be confirmed by official U.S. government announcements and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or The New York Times). The tariff must be specifically targeted at electric vehicles manufactured in China and not part of a broader tariff on all Chinese goods or all vehicles. If no such tariff meeting these criteria is implemented by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is there a plan for the United States to introduce a major tariff on electric vehicles produced in China by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if, by August 31, 2024, the United States officially enacts a tariff of 50% or more on the importation of electric vehicles made in China. This enactment must be validated through official announcements from the U.S. government and covered by at least two prominent news organizations (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or The New York Times). The tariff must be directed specifically at electric vehicles from China and not be part of a broader tariff affecting all Chinese products or all types of vehicles. If such a tariff that meets these specifications is not enacted by the designated date, the inquiry will be deemed negative.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by August 2024: (a) Elon Musk conducts a live interview with Sergey Brin on X, and (b) the United States implements a significant tariff on Chinese-made electric vehicles?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met by August 31, 2024:

1. Elon Musk conducts a live interview with Sergey Brin on X (formerly known as Twitter). For a positive resolution, the following criteria must be met:
   - The interview must be conducted live on the X platform.
   - Elon Musk must be the primary interviewer.
   - Sergey Brin must be the interviewee.
   - The event must be officially announced by X or Elon Musk prior to its occurrence.
   - The interview must be publicly accessible on the X platform.
   - At least two major news outlets (such as CNN, Fox News, MSNBC, Reuters, or Associated Press) must report on the event either before or after it takes place.

2. The United States officially implements a tariff of 50% or higher on imports of Chinese-made electric vehicles. The implementation must be confirmed by official U.S. government announcements and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or The New York Times). The tariff must be specifically targeted at electric vehicles manufactured in China and not part of a broader tariff on all Chinese goods or all vehicles.

If both of these conditions are met by August 31, 2024, the question resolves as YES. If either condition is not met by this date, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: By August 2024, will the following two events take place: (a) Elon Musk interviews Sergey Brin live on X, and (b) the United States enacts a substantial tariff on electric vehicles produced in China?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with a YES if both of the subsequent criteria are fulfilled by August 31, 2024:

1. Elon Musk holds a live interview with Sergey Brin on X (previously known as Twitter). For a positive outcome, the following requirements must be satisfied:
   - The interview must occur live on the X platform.
   - Elon Musk should serve as the main interviewer.
   - Sergey Brin must be the one being interviewed.
   - The event should be officially announced by either X or Elon Musk before it occurs.
   - The interview has to be accessible to the public on the X platform.
   - At least two prominent news organizations (like CNN, Fox News, MSNBC, Reuters, or Associated Press) must cover the event either prior to or after it happens.

2. The United States formally imposes a tariff of 50% or more on imports of electric vehicles made in China. This implementation must be verified through official announcements from the U.S. government and reported by at least two major news organizations (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or The New York Times). The tariff must specifically target electric vehicles manufactured in China, not as part of a broader tariff affecting all Chinese products or all vehicles.

If both conditions are satisfied by August 31, 2024, the question will be answered with a YES. If either condition is not met by that date, the answer will be NO.

question.title: Will the World Health Organization declare the current Nipah virus outbreak over by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the World Health Organization (WHO) officially declares the ongoing Nipah virus outbreak over by August 31, 2024. The declaration must be confirmed through official WHO announcements or reports from at least three reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC). The outbreak referred to in this question is the one that prompted heightened public health responses globally. If no such declaration ending the outbreak is made by the resolution date, or if the WHO extends the emergency status beyond August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Will the World Health Organization announce the conclusion of the current Nipah virus outbreak by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if the World Health Organization (WHO) formally states that the ongoing Nipah virus outbreak has ended by August 31, 2024. The statement must be verified through official announcements from the WHO or reports from at least three credible news organizations (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC). The outbreak in question is the one that led to increased public health measures worldwide. If such a declaration signaling the end of the outbreak is not made by the specified resolution date, or if the WHO prolongs the emergency status past August 31, 2024, the outcome will be negative.

question.title: Will the mpox outbreak in the Central African Republic be declared over by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the mpox outbreak in the Central African Republic is officially declared over by the country's health authorities or the World Health Organization (WHO). The declaration must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or CNN). If no such declaration is made by the resolution date, or if the outbreak is still ongoing, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Will the mpox epidemic in the Central African Republic be officially considered concluded by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will result in a YES if, by July 31, 2024, the mpox epidemic in the Central African Republic is formally declared concluded by the nation's health authorities or the World Health Organization (WHO). The announcement must be covered by at least two credible international news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or CNN). If no such announcement occurs by the resolution date, or if the epidemic persists, the inquiry will result in a NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Will the World Health Organization declare the current Nipah virus outbreak over by August 2024? (b) Will the mpox outbreak in the Central African Republic be declared over by July 2024?

The declaration must be confirmed through official WHO announcements or reports from at least three reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC). The outbreak referred to is the one that prompted heightened public health responses globally. If no such declaration ending the outbreak is made by the resolution date, or if the WHO extends the emergency status beyond August 31, 2024, this part will resolve as NO. (2) The mpox outbreak in the Central African Republic is officially declared over by the country's health authorities or the World Health Organization (WHO) by July 31, 2024. The declaration must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or CNN). If no such declaration is made by the resolution date, or if the outbreak is still ongoing, this part will resolve as NO. The overall question will resolve as YES only if both parts resolve as YES.

para_P.title: Will both of the following happen: (a) Will the World Health Organization announce the current Nipah virus outbreak is over by August 2024? (b) Will the mpox outbreak in the Central African Republic be announced as concluded by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered YES if both of the following criteria are satisfied: (1) The World Health Organization (WHO) formally announces that the ongoing Nipah virus outbreak is concluded by August 31, 2024. This declaration must be validated through official WHO communications or reports from a minimum of three credible news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC). The outbreak in question is the one that led to increased global public health measures. If no such declaration is made by the resolution date, or if the WHO prolongs the emergency status past August 31, 2024, this component will resolve as NO. (2) The mpox outbreak in the Central African Republic is officially declared over by the nation's health officials or the World Health Organization (WHO) by July 31, 2024. This declaration must be reported by at least two reputable international news organizations (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or CNN). If no such declaration occurs by the resolution date, or if the outbreak continues, this portion will resolve as NO. The entire question will resolve as YES only if both segments resolve as YES.

question.title: Will the Bank of England announce an interest rate cut by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Bank of England officially announces an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed by official Bank of England communications, such as press releases, Monetary Policy Committee statements, or public speeches by Bank officials. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. Note that the actual implementation date of the rate cut can be after August 31, 2024, as long as the announcement itself occurs by that date. The interest rate in question refers to the Bank Rate, which is the Bank of England's primary tool for monetary policy.

para_P.title: Will the Bank of England declare a reduction in interest rates before August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if the Bank of England makes an official declaration regarding a reduction in interest rates to be effective by August 31, 2024. The confirmation must come through formal communications from the Bank of England, such as press releases, statements from the Monetary Policy Committee, or public addresses by Bank representatives. If no such declaration occurs by the resolution date, the inquiry will be deemed negative. It is important to note that the actual date when the rate reduction takes effect can occur after August 31, 2024, provided that the announcement itself is made by that date. The interest rate in question pertains to the Bank Rate, which serves as the primary instrument for the Bank of England's monetary policy.

question.title: Will India eliminate export taxes on agricultural products by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Indian government officially announces or implements a policy to completely eliminate export taxes on agricultural products. The policy must be confirmed by official government communications or reported by at least two reputable international news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or Associated Press). Partial reductions in export taxes or the elimination of taxes on only some agricultural products will not be sufficient for a YES resolution. If no such policy is introduced or implemented by the resolution date, or if only partial measures are taken, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will India remove export duties on agricultural goods by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Indian government makes an official declaration or enacts a policy to fully abolish export duties on agricultural goods. The policy must be validated by official government announcements or reported by at least two credible international news organizations (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or Associated Press). Any partial reductions in export duties or the removal of duties on only certain agricultural goods will not suffice for a YES outcome. If no such policy is introduced or enacted by the resolution date, or if only partial actions are taken, the inquiry will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) the Bank of England announces an interest rate cut by August 2024, and (b) India eliminates export taxes on agricultural products by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if both of the following occur: (a) The Bank of England officially announces an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed by official Bank of England communications, such as press releases, Monetary Policy Committee statements, or public speeches by Bank officials. The actual implementation date of the rate cut can be after August 31, 2024, as long as the announcement itself occurs by that date. The interest rate in question refers to the Bank Rate, which is the Bank of England's primary tool for monetary policy. (b) By July 31, 2024, the Indian government officially announces or implements a policy to completely eliminate export taxes on agricultural products. The policy must be confirmed by official government communications or reported by at least two reputable international news outlets, such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or Associated Press. Partial reductions in export taxes or the elimination of taxes on only some agricultural products will not be sufficient for a YES resolution. If both conditions are not met by their respective resolution dates, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is it true that the following two events will take place: (a) the Bank of England will declare a reduction in interest rates by August 2024, and (b) India will remove export taxes on agricultural goods by July 2024?

(b) By July 31, 2024, the Indian government makes an official announcement or takes action to fully abolish export taxes on agricultural products. question.body: This question will resolve as YES if India's central bank's preferred inflation measure reports a month-over-month increase greater than 0.5% in any single month between October 2023 and July 31, 2024. If no such increase is reported during this period, the question will resolve as NO. Note that this question focuses on the month-over-month change, not year-over-year or any other time frame.

question.title: Will Elon Musk conduct a live interview with Satya Nadella on X by August 2024?
question.body:

1. The interview must be conducted live on the X platform.
2. Elon Musk must be the primary interviewer.
3. Satya Nadella must be the interviewee.
4. The event must be officially announced by X or Elon Musk prior to its occurrence.
5. The interview must be publicly accessible on the X platform.
6. At least two major news outlets (such as CNN, Fox News, MSNBC, Reuters, or Associated Press) must report on the event either before or after it takes place.

If all these conditions are met by August 31, 2024, the question resolves as YES. If any of these conditions are not met by this date, or if the interview does not occur, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the Mexican economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Mexican economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the National Institute of Statistics and Geography of Mexico. The question resolves as NO if the Mexican economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

If no resolution that meets all these conditions is reached by the indicated date, or if no significant strike takes place, the inquiry will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by July 2024: (a) The European Central Bank announces an interest rate cut, and (b) Hyundai Motor Company resolves a major workers' strike?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following events occur by July 31, 2024:

(a) The European Central Bank (ECB) officially announces a decrease in its main refinancing operations rate. The announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the ECB or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Governing Council of the ECB and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual ECB members will not count for resolution.

(b) Hyundai Motor Company reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike. For the resolution to be considered valid, the strike must involve at least 1,000 Hyundai Motor Company workers, last for at least one week, and the resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Hyundai Motor Company and the involved union. Additionally, the resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If either of these events does not occur by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: By July 2024, will the following two events take place: (a) An announcement of an interest rate reduction by the European Central Bank, and (b) A major workers' strike at Hyundai Motor Company coming to a resolution?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with a YES if both of these events transpire by July 31, 2024:

(a) The European Central Bank (ECB) officially declares a reduction in its primary refinancing operations rate. This declaration must be validated by official communications from the ECB or reported by a minimum of two significant financial news outlets (like Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate reduction must be a formal decision made by the Governing Council of the ECB and conveyed in their official statement or press briefing following a meeting. Any conjecture regarding future rate reductions or unofficial remarks from individual ECB members will not be sufficient for resolution.

(b) Hyundai Motor Company successfully negotiates with unionized workers, leading to the conclusion of a substantial strike. For the resolution to be deemed valid, the strike must involve no fewer than 1,000 workers from Hyundai Motor Company, persist for a minimum of one week, and the resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Hyundai Motor Company and the relevant union. Furthermore, the resolution must be covered by at least two credible international news organizations (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If either of these events fails to occur by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will the S&P 500 index reach or exceed 4,800 points by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, at any point between October 1, 2023 and August 31, 2024, the S&P 500 index reaches or exceeds 4,800 points. The 4,800 point level is chosen as a representative value that the index might have been at before a significant drop. Verification will be based on official index reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the New York Stock Exchange. If the index does not reach 4,800 points during this period, the question resolves as NO. Note that intraday highs count for resolution; the index does not need to close at or above 4,800 points.

para_P.title: Is it possible for the S&P 500 index to hit or surpass 4,800 points by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed affirmative if the S&P 500 index hits or surpasses 4,800 points at any time from October 1, 2023, to August 31, 2024. Confirmation will rely on official reports from trusted financial market data sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the New York Stock Exchange. It is important to note that intraday peaks are considered for resolution; the index does not have to close at or above 4,800 points.

question.title: Will Shopify lay off at least 1,800 employees by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Shopify has confirmed the layoff of at least 1,800 employees as part of its AI-focused reorganization plan. Confirmation must come from official company announcements, regulatory filings, or reports by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The layoffs must be explicitly linked to the AI-focused reorganization plan announced in 2023. If Shopify confirms a lower number of layoffs, or if no such confirmation meeting these criteria is made by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO. Partial layoffs or phased implementations that do not reach the 1,800 employee threshold by the resolution date will also result in a NO resolution.

question.title: Will the Philippine government enforce a shutdown of Chinese-run online trading platforms by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, there are confirmed reports that the Philippine government has successfully enforced a shutdown of Chinese-run online trading platforms in the Philippines. The enforcement must be reported by at least two reputable international news organizations (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or CNN) and involve official government actions leading to the cessation of operations for a significant number of these trading platforms. 'Significant' in this context means at least 50% of known Chinese-run online trading platforms in the Philippines at the time of enforcement. The shutdown must be a result of government policy or directive, not due to voluntary closures or economic factors. If no such enforcement meeting these criteria is confirmed by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will the Philippine authorities implement a closure of online trading platforms operated by Chinese entities by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, by July 31, 2024, there are verified reports indicating that the Philippine authorities have effectively implemented a closure of online trading platforms managed by Chinese entities in the Philippines. This enforcement must be documented by at least two credible international news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or CNN) and must involve official governmental actions leading to the discontinuation of operations for a considerable number of these trading platforms. 'Considerable' in this context refers to at least 50% of the identified Chinese-operated online trading platforms in the Philippines at the time of enforcement. The closure must stem from government policy or directive, rather than voluntary shutdowns or economic circumstances. If no enforcement that meets these criteria is confirmed by the resolution date, the inquiry will be answered with a NO.

question.title: Will the International Monetary Fund announce new funding commitments totaling over $400 million by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the International Monetary Fund officially announces one or more new funding commitments that collectively total more than $400 million. The announcement(s) must be made through official IMF channels (such as their website or press releases) and be reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The funding commitments must be new initiatives or significant expansions of existing programs, not continuations of previously announced commitments. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, or if the total of new funding commitments does not exceed $400 million, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission's climate disclosure rule be reinstated by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission's rule on climate disclosures, previously blocked by a court decision, is reinstated. The reinstatement must be confirmed by official court documents or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, or Wall Street Journal). The reinstatement could occur through a successful appeal, a reversal of the court's decision, or any other legal mechanism that results in the rule taking effect. If the rule remains blocked or is not reinstated by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will the climate disclosure regulation from the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission be restored by July 2024?

The restoration could take place via a successful appeal, a reversal of the judicial ruling, or any other legal process that leads to the regulation being enacted. If the regulation remains halted or is not restored by the designated date, the inquiry will be deemed negative.

question.title: Will California conduct a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, California conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a YES resolution, the following criteria must be met:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of California.
2. The primary focus of the referendum must be on abortion rights protection.
3. The referendum results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

If no such referendum meeting these criteria occurs by August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that merely proposing or planning a referendum without actually conducting it by the specified date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

para_P.title: Is California going to hold a public vote on abortion rights before August 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with YES if, by August 31, 2024, California holds a public vote aimed specifically at establishing protections for abortion rights within the state. For a YES determination, the following conditions must be satisfied:

1. The public vote must be officially declared and carried out by the state of California.
2. The main emphasis of the vote must be on safeguarding abortion rights.
3. The outcomes of the vote must be publicly disclosed by official state sources or widely acknowledged news outlets.

If no such vote that meets these conditions takes place by August 31, 2024, the question will be answered with NO. It is important to note that simply suggesting or organizing a vote without actually executing it by the given date does not qualify for a YES determination.

question.title: Will Oregon hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Oregon officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a positive resolution:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the Oregon state government.
2. The referendum must explicitly address the issue of abortion rights protection.
3. The results of the referendum must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

The question will resolve as NO if:

1. No such referendum occurs by August 31, 2024.
2. A planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond the specified date.
3. A referendum is held, but it does not specifically focus on enshrining protection for abortion rights.

Note: This question does not consider the outcome of the referendum, only whether it takes place within the specified timeframe.

para_P.title: Will there be a public vote in Oregon regarding abortion rights before August 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, by August 31, 2024, Oregon officially holds a public vote aimed at establishing legal safeguards for abortion rights within the state. For a positive outcome:

1. The public vote must be formally declared and executed by the Oregon state authorities.
2. The public vote must directly pertain to the matter of protecting abortion rights.
3. The results of the public vote must be disclosed through official state communications or reputable news outlets.

The inquiry will be answered with a NO if:

1. No such public vote occurs by August 31, 2024.
2. An anticipated public vote is called off or delayed past the specified date.
3. A public vote takes place, but it does not specifically aim to establish legal protections for abortion rights.

Note: This inquiry does not take into account the outcome of the public vote, only whether it occurs within the designated timeframe.

For Oregon:
1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the Oregon state government.

3. The results of the referendum must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

The question will resolve as NO if either California or Oregon does not conduct such a referendum by August 31, 2024, or if the referendums do not meet the specified criteria.

question.title: Will the FDA approve MDMA as a therapy for PTSD by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) officially approves MDMA (3,4-Methylenedioxymethamphetamine) for use as a therapy for Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD) by August 31, 2024. For a positive resolution, the approval must be confirmed through an official announcement from the FDA and reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers). The approval must specifically be for the use of MDMA in treating PTSD, not for any other condition or use. If no such approval is granted by the resolution date, or if the FDA explicitly rejects or delays the approval beyond August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Will MDMA receive FDA authorization as a treatment for PTSD before August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) grants official authorization for MDMA (3,4-Methylenedioxymethamphetamine) to be utilized as a treatment for Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD) by August 31, 2024. For a positive outcome, this authorization must be validated with an official announcement from the FDA and corroborated by at least two credible news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers). The authorization must specifically pertain to the application of MDMA in the treatment of PTSD, excluding any other conditions or uses. If such authorization is not provided by the resolution date, or if the FDA explicitly denies or postpones the approval past August 31, 2024, the inquiry will be resolved as NO.

question.title: Will Mexican authorities officially declare the dismantling of the La Familia Michoacana drug cartel by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Mexican authorities (such as federal law enforcement agencies or high-ranking government officials) make an official public declaration stating that the La Familia Michoacana drug cartel has been dismantled or effectively neutralized as a criminal organization. The declaration must be reported by at least two reputable international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, CNN, or major Mexican news sources). The declaration should indicate a significant disruption to the cartel's leadership structure, operations, or ability to function as a cohesive criminal entity. Mere arrests of individual members or partial disruptions to the cartel's activities do not qualify for a YES resolution. If no such official declaration meeting these criteria is made by July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Will the La Familia Michoacana drug cartel be officially declared dismantled by Mexican authorities before July 2024?

para_P.title: Will there be a reduction in the interest rate by the Central Bank of Israel before July 2024?

question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, there are credible reports from at least two major international news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Al Jazeera) of large protests in the United Kingdom specifically in response to the government's decision to cut healthcare funding. To qualify as 'large', the protests must involve at least 1,000 participants in a single gathering or multiple coordinated gatherings totaling at least 1,000 participants across the United Kingdom. The protests must be explicitly linked to the issue of healthcare funding cuts. If no such protests meeting these criteria occur by the specified date, or if the funding cuts are rescinded before causing such protests, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will a court rule on the liability of a major hotel chain operator by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, a court of law issues a ruling on whether a major hotel chain operator is liable for negligence or gross negligence in relation to an incident resulting in significant harm or loss. The ruling must be documented in official court records and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, CNN, or The New York Times). If no such ruling occurs by the resolution date, or if the case is settled out of court without a formal ruling, the question resolves as NO. The work requirement pertains to the stipulation that beneficiaries must work or participate in other qualifying activities to obtain Medicaid benefits. If either criterion is not fulfilled by the respective resolution date, the inquiry resolves as NO.

question.title: Will BNSF Railway reach a new agreement with the conductors' union addressing work schedule predictability by August 2024?

The agreement should directly address the issue of making schedules more predictable for train conductors, as mentioned in the ongoing dispute. question.title: Will U.S. previously occupied home sales increase for three consecutive months by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, there are three consecutive months where sales of previously occupied homes in the U.S. show an increase compared to the previous month. The data must be verified by reputable sources such as the National Association of Realtors or other widely recognized real estate market analysts. The increases must be reported in terms of seasonally adjusted annual rates. If no such consecutive monthly increases are reported by the resolution date, or if only one or two months show an increase, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will there be a rise in sales of previously owned homes in the U.S. for three straight months by July 2024?

question.title: Will Kamala Harris announce her running mate at a rally in Los Angeles by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Vice President Kamala Harris publicly announces her running mate for the upcoming election at a rally held in Los Angeles, California. The announcement must be made by Harris herself during the rally and must clearly identify the individual chosen as her running mate. The event and announcement must be confirmed by at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Washington Post, CNN, or Fox News) within 24 hours of the rally. If Harris does not make such an announcement at a Los Angeles rally by the end of August 2024, or if the announcement is made through other means or at a different location, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: By the end of August 2024, will Vice President Kamala Harris reveal her choice for running mate during a rally in Los Angeles?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed YES if, on or before August 31, 2024, Kamala Harris, the Vice President, makes a public declaration of her running mate for the forthcoming election at a rally taking place in Los Angeles, California. The announcement must be delivered directly by Harris during the rally and must explicitly name the person selected as her running mate. The occurrence of the event and the announcement must be verified by at least two credible national news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Washington Post, CNN, or Fox News) within a day following the rally. If Harris fails to announce her running mate at a Los Angeles rally by the conclusion of August 2024, or if the announcement occurs through alternative channels or at a different venue, the inquiry will be resolved as NO.

question.title: Will the French economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the French economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the National Institute of Statistics and Economic Studies of France. The question resolves as NO if the French economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

para_P.title: Can the French economy steer clear of a recession before July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if the French economy has not entered a recession by July 31, 2024. For the purposes of this inquiry, a recession is characterized as experiencing two successive quarters of declining GDP growth, as reported by the National Institute of Statistics and Economic Studies of France. The response will be NO if the French economy undergoes two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any time from October 1, 2023, through July 31, 2024.

question.title: Will the Central Bank of Mexico's preferred inflation measure show a monthly increase exceeding 0.5% by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Central Bank of Mexico's preferred inflation measure reports a month-over-month increase greater than 0.5% in any single month between October 2023 and July 31, 2024. The increase must be officially published by the Central Bank of Mexico or a relevant Mexican government agency and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, El Financiero). If no such increase is reported during this period, the question will resolve as NO. Note that this question focuses on the month-over-month change, not year-over-year or any other time frame.

para_P.title: By July 2024, will there be a monthly rise in the Central Bank of Mexico's chosen inflation indicator that surpasses 0.5%?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if the Central Bank of Mexico's selected inflation indicator indicates a month-to-month rise exceeding 0.5% in any month from October 2023 through July 31, 2024. The increase must be officially documented by the Central Bank of Mexico or an appropriate Mexican governmental body and reported by a minimum of two credible financial news outlets (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, El Financiero). If no such rise is noted during this timeframe, the inquiry will be answered with a NO. It is important to emphasize that this question pertains to the month-over-month variation, rather than year-over-year changes or any other duration.

question.title: Will the French economy avoid a recession by July 2024, and will the Central Bank of Mexico's preferred inflation measure show a monthly increase exceeding 0.5% by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met: (1) The French economy does not enter a recession by July 31, 2024. A recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the National Institute of Statistics and Economic Studies of France. The economy must not experience two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024. (2) The Central Bank of Mexico's preferred inflation measure reports a month-over-month increase greater than 0.5% in any single month between October 2023 and July 31, 2024. This increase must be officially published by the Central Bank of Mexico or a relevant Mexican government agency and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources, such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or El Financiero. The question resolves as NO if either condition is not met.

para_P.title: Will France's economy steer clear of recession by July 2024, and will the inflation metric favored by the Central Bank of Mexico show a monthly rise surpassing 0.5% by that time?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if both of the following criteria are fulfilled: (1) France's economy does not fall into a recession by July 31, 2024. A recession is identified as two successive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the National Institute of Statistics and Economic Studies of France. The economy must not undergo two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any moment from October 1, 2023, to July 31, 2024. (2) The inflation indicator preferred by the Central Bank of Mexico must document a month-over-month increase exceeding 0.5% in at least one month between October 2023 and July 31, 2024. This increase must be officially announced by the Central Bank of Mexico or an appropriate Mexican government agency and reported by a minimum of two credible financial news outlets, such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or El Financiero. The answer will be NO if either of these conditions is not satisfied.

question.title: Will the first phase of a major Native American drone delivery project in Texas be completed by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the first phase of a large-scale drone delivery project planned by a Native American tribe in Texas is completed. The tribe in question is the Kickapoo Traditional Tribe of Texas. Completion of the first phase must be confirmed through official announcements by the tribe or reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). Completion implies that the drone delivery infrastructure is established and ready for operation, even if full service has not yet begun. If the first phase of the project is not completed by July 31, 2024, or if there is insufficient evidence of its completion, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is the initial stage of a significant drone delivery initiative by a Native American tribe in Texas expected to be finished by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered affirmatively if the first stage of a large-scale drone delivery initiative organized by the Kickapoo Traditional Tribe of Texas is finalized by July 31, 2024. Confirmation of completion must come from official statements by the tribe or coverage by at least two credible news organizations (like Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). Completion means that the drone delivery system is set up and ready for use, even if full operations have not commenced. Conversely, if the initial stage of the project is not finished by July 31, 2024, or there is inadequate proof of its completion, the answer will be negative.

question.title: Will the Food and Agriculture Organization announce new funding commitments totaling over $400 million by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Food and Agriculture Organization officially announces one or more new funding commitments that collectively total more than $400 million. The announcement(s) must be made through official FAO channels (such as their website or press releases) and be reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The funding commitments must be new initiatives or significant expansions of existing programs, not continuations of previously announced commitments. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, or if the total of new funding commitments does not exceed $400 million, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is it expected that the Food and Agriculture Organization will reveal new funding pledges exceeding $400 million by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Food and Agriculture Organization formally discloses one or more new funding pledges that together surpass $400 million. The announcement(s) must be communicated through official FAO platforms (such as their website or press releases) and be covered by at least two credible news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The funding pledges must represent new initiatives or substantial expansions of current programs, rather than extensions of previously disclosed commitments. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, or if the total of new funding pledges does not exceed $400 million, the inquiry resolves as NO.
