question.body:
(a) The first phase of a large-scale drone delivery project planned by the Kickapoo Traditional Tribe of Texas must be completed by July 31, 2024. Completion implies that the drone delivery infrastructure is established and ready for operation, even if full service has not yet begun. If the first phase of the project is not completed by July 31, 2024, or if there is insufficient evidence of its completion, this part resolves as NO.

(b) The Food and Agriculture Organization must officially announce one or more new funding commitments that collectively total more than $400 million by July 31, 2024. The announcement(s) must be made through official FAO channels (such as their website or press releases) and be reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The funding commitments must be new initiatives or significant expansions of existing programs, not continuations of previously announced commitments. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, or if the total of new funding commitments does not exceed $400 million, this part resolves as NO.

The combined question resolves as YES only if both (a) and (b) occur as described by July 31, 2024.

para_P.title: By July 2024, will the completion of a significant drone delivery initiative by the Kickapoo Traditional Tribe of Texas and the FAO's announcement of new funding exceeding $400 million both take place?
para_P.body:
(a) The initial phase of a large drone delivery initiative organized by the Kickapoo Traditional Tribe of Texas is required to be finalized by July 31, 2024. Confirmation of completion must come from official statements by the tribe or coverage by at least two credible news outlets (like Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). Completion indicates that the drone delivery system is set up and operational, even if full service hasn't started yet. If the first phase is not completed by July 31, 2024, or if there is inadequate proof of its completion, this segment will resolve as NO.

(b) The Food and Agriculture Organization must make an official declaration of one or more new funding commitments that together exceed $400 million by July 31, 2024. These announcements must be communicated through official FAO channels (such as their website or press releases) and reported by at least two reputable news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The funding commitments must represent new projects or significant enhancements to existing programs, and not just continuations of previously disclosed commitments. If no such announcement is made by the deadline, or if the total of new funding commitments does not surpass $400 million, this part will resolve as NO.

The overall question will resolve as YES only if both (a) and (b) occur as specified by July 31, 2024.

question.title: Will Minnesota hold a referendum on housing affordability by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the state of Minnesota officially conducts a referendum regarding housing affordability. The referendum must be a formal, state-wide vote on a proposed constitutional amendment or legislative measure specifically addressing housing affordability. The occurrence of the referendum must be verifiable through official state government announcements or reports from at least three major, reputable news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, or CNN). If no such referendum is held by the specified date, or if a planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that this question only concerns the occurrence of the referendum itself, not its outcome.

para_P.title: Will there be a vote in Minnesota concerning housing affordability before July 2024?

Please note that this question pertains solely to the occurrence of the vote, not its results.

question.title: Will Tim Scott publicly retract his statement about Biden's stance on criminal justice reform?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Tim Scott publicly retracts or significantly alters his statement regarding Joe Biden's position on criminal justice reform. The retraction or alteration must be reported by at least two major news outlets (such as CNN, Fox News, MSNBC, The New York Times, or The Washington Post). A significant alteration would involve a substantial change to the core message of his original statement, not just a minor clarification or rewording. If no such retraction or significant alteration is reported by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO. For the purpose of this question, 'publicly' means through official statements, interviews, social media posts from verified accounts, or during public appearances.

para_P.title: Will Tim Scott take back his comments regarding Biden's views on criminal justice reform?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, by August 31, 2024, Tim Scott takes back or makes substantial changes to his comments about Joe Biden's views on criminal justice reform. A substantial change would entail a major shift in the fundamental message of his original remarks, rather than a simple clarification or rephrasing. If no such retraction or significant change is reported by the designated date, the inquiry will be answered with a NO. For the purposes of this inquiry, 'publicly' refers to official statements, interviews, social media posts from verified accounts, or during public engagements.

question.title: Will Nicholas Collon be recognized as the youngest music director of a major orchestra by July 2024?

question.title: Will the World Health Organization declare the current Zika virus outbreak over by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the World Health Organization (WHO) officially declares the ongoing Zika virus outbreak over by August 31, 2024. The declaration must be confirmed through official WHO announcements or reports from at least three reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC). The outbreak referred to in this question is the one that prompted heightened public health responses globally. If no such declaration ending the outbreak is made by the resolution date, or if the WHO extends the emergency status beyond August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Will the World Health Organization announce the conclusion of the current Zika virus epidemic by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered TRUE if the World Health Organization (WHO) formally announces that the ongoing Zika virus epidemic has concluded by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be validated through official communications from the WHO or reports from a minimum of three credible news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC). The epidemic mentioned in this inquiry is the one that led to increased global public health measures. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, or if the WHO prolongs the emergency status beyond August 31, 2024, the inquiry will be deemed FALSE.

question.title: Will the Global Fund announce new funding commitments totaling over $400 million by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Global Fund officially announces one or more new funding commitments that collectively total more than $400 million. The announcement(s) must be made through official Global Fund channels (such as their website or press releases) and be reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The funding commitments must be new initiatives or significant expansions of existing programs, not continuations of previously announced commitments. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, or if the total of new funding commitments does not exceed $400 million, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Global Fund formally reveals one or more new funding pledges that together surpass $400 million. The funding pledges should be new projects or substantial enhancements of current programs, rather than extensions of previously declared commitments. If no such disclosure is made by the resolution date, or if the aggregate of new funding pledges does not exceed $400 million, the question will resolve as NO.

The funding commitments must be new initiatives or significant expansions of existing programs, not continuations of previously announced commitments. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, or if the total of new funding commitments does not exceed $400 million, the condition is not met. The question resolves as YES only if both conditions (a) and (b) are satisfied.

question.title: Will Spain's IBEX 35 index reach or exceed 10,000 points by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, at any point between October 1, 2023 and August 31, 2024, Spain's IBEX 35 index reaches or exceeds 10,000 points. The 10,000 point level is chosen as a representative value that the index might have been at before a significant drop. Verification will be based on official index reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the Bolsa de Madrid. If the index does not reach 10,000 points during this period, the question resolves as NO. Note that intraday highs count for resolution; the index does not need to close at or above 10,000 points.

question.title: Will the NFL settle the 'Sunday Ticket' antitrust case for less than $4.7 billion by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if by July 31, 2024, the NFL reaches a settlement in the 'Sunday Ticket' antitrust case for an amount less than $4,707,259,944. The settlement must be officially confirmed through court documents or public announcements by involved parties. If no such settlement is reached by the resolution date, or if the settlement amount is equal to or more than $4.7 billion, the question resolves as NO. For context, as of October 1, 2023, a federal jury has ordered the NFL to pay this amount for violating antitrust laws in distributing out-of-market Sunday afternoon games on a premium subscription service.

para_P.title: Is it possible that the NFL will finalize the 'Sunday Ticket' antitrust settlement for under $4.7 billion by the end of July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if by July 31, 2024, the NFL concludes a settlement in the 'Sunday Ticket' antitrust litigation for a sum less than $4,707,259,944. The agreement must be officially validated through legal documentation or public statements from the parties involved. If such a settlement is not achieved by the deadline, or if the settlement amount is equal to or exceeds $4.7 billion, the answer will be negative. For reference, as of October 1, 2023, a federal jury has mandated the NFL to pay this amount due to breaches of antitrust regulations in the distribution of out-of-market Sunday afternoon games via a premium subscription service.

If either one or both of these criteria are not met by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: By July 2024, will both of these events take place: (1) Netflix reveals a significant new partnership in sports media, and (2) the NFL concludes the 'Sunday Ticket' antitrust lawsuit for under $4.7 billion?

question.title: Will Illinois maintain its current legal stance on abortion access by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Illinois Supreme Court has not reversed or significantly altered its 2023 decision that struck down state laws regulating abortion providers more strictly than other health care providers and banned a common second-trimester procedure. The question will resolve as NO if, by July 31, 2024, the Illinois Supreme Court has reversed this decision, reinstated stricter regulations on abortion providers, or reinstated the ban on the second-trimester procedure. The resolution will be based on official court decisions or credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, The New York Times, The Washington Post).

para_P.title: Will the current legal position regarding abortion access in Illinois remain unchanged by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Illinois Supreme Court has neither overturned nor substantially modified its 2023 ruling that invalidated state laws imposing stricter regulations on abortion providers compared to other healthcare providers and prohibited a widely used second-trimester procedure. Conversely, the answer will be NO if, by July 31, 2024, the Illinois Supreme Court has overturned this ruling, reinstated stricter regulations on abortion providers, or reinstated the prohibition on the second-trimester procedure. The determination will rely on official court rulings or credible coverage from at least three leading news outlets (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, The New York Times, The Washington Post).

Enactment must be confirmed through official announcements by the HHS, court rulings, or other authoritative legal sources, and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, The Wall Street Journal, or The New York Times). The determination will rely on official court rulings or credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, The New York Times, The Washington Post). question.title: Will the Bank of England announce an interest rate cut by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Bank of England officially announces an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed by official Bank of England communications, such as press releases, Monetary Policy Committee statements, or public speeches by Bank officials. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. Note that the actual implementation date of the rate cut can be after August 31, 2024, as long as the announcement itself occurs by that date. The interest rate in question refers to the Bank Rate, which is the Bank of England's primary tool for monetary policy.

para_P.title: Will the Bank of England declare a reduction in interest rates by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be resolved as YES if the Bank of England formally declares a reduction in interest rates to take effect by August 31, 2024. The declaration must be validated by official communications from the Bank of England, such as press releases, statements from the Monetary Policy Committee, or public addresses by Bank officials. If no such declaration is made by the resolution date, the inquiry resolves as NO. It is important to note that the actual date for the implementation of the rate reduction may occur after August 31, 2024, provided that the announcement itself is made by that date. The interest rate in question pertains to the Bank Rate, which is the primary instrument of monetary policy used by the Bank of England.

question.title: Will the German economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the German economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the Federal Statistical Office of Germany. The question resolves as NO if the German economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

para_P.title: Can Germany's economy steer clear of a recession before July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed affirmative if, by July 31, 2024, the economy of Germany does not fall into a recession. For the context of this question, a recession is characterized by two successive quarters of declining GDP growth as reported by the Federal Statistical Office of Germany. It will be considered negative if the German economy undergoes two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any time from October 1, 2023, to July 31, 2024.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) the Bank of England announce an interest rate cut by August 2024 and (b) the German economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met: (a) The Bank of England officially announces an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed by official Bank of England communications, such as press releases, Monetary Policy Committee statements, or public speeches by Bank officials. The actual implementation date of the rate cut can be after August 31, 2024, as long as the announcement itself occurs by that date. The interest rate in question refers to the Bank Rate, which is the Bank of England's primary tool for monetary policy. (b) The German economy does not enter a recession by July 31, 2024. A recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the Federal Statistical Office of Germany. The question resolves as NO if the German economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

para_P.title: Is it possible for both of the following to take place: (a) the Bank of England to declare a reduction in interest rates by August 2024 and (b) the German economy to steer clear of a recession by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed affirmative if both of the subsequent criteria are fulfilled: (a) The Bank of England formally declares a reduction in interest rates to be effective by August 31, 2024. This declaration must be validated by official communications from the Bank of England, including press releases, statements from the Monetary Policy Committee, or public addresses by Bank representatives. The actual date for the rate cut can be set after August 31, 2024, provided that the announcement itself is made by that date. The interest rate in question pertains to the Bank Rate, which is the primary instrument of monetary policy for the Bank of England. (b) The German economy does not fall into a recession by July 31, 2024. A recession is characterized as two successive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the Federal Statistical Office of Germany. The question will be resolved negatively if the German economy encounters two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

question.title: Will an enforceable ethics code for U.S. Congress members be established by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, an enforceable ethics code specifically for U.S. Congress members is officially adopted by the United States government. The adoption must be confirmed by at least two major, reputable news outlets (such as The New York Times, The Washington Post, Reuters, or Associated Press). The ethics code must be legally binding and applicable to all sitting Congress members. It should outline clear standards of conduct and mechanisms for enforcement. If no such code meeting these criteria is established and officially adopted by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO. Note that mere proposals or discussions about such a code do not qualify for a YES resolution; the code must be formally adopted and enforceable.

para_P.title: Will there be a legally binding ethics code for members of the U.S. Congress by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, by July 31, 2024, a legally binding ethics code specifically for members of the U.S. Congress is officially put into place by the United States government. Confirmation of this adoption must come from at least two major, credible news organizations (such as The New York Times, The Washington Post, Reuters, or Associated Press). The ethics code must be enforceable and applicable to all current Congress members, detailing explicit standards of behavior and enforcement mechanisms. If no such code that meets these requirements is established and officially enacted by the deadline, the inquiry will be answered with a NO. It is important to note that simply proposing or discussing such a code does not qualify for a YES answer; the code must be formally enacted and enforceable.

question.title: Will Michigan hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Michigan officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a positive resolution:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the Michigan state government.
2. The referendum must explicitly address the issue of abortion rights protection.
3. The results of the referendum must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

The question will resolve as NO if:

1. No such referendum occurs by August 31, 2024.
2. A planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond the specified date.
3. A referendum is held, but it does not specifically focus on enshrining protection for abortion rights.

Note: This question does not consider the outcome of the referendum, only whether it takes place within the specified timeframe.

para_P.title: Will Michigan conduct a public vote regarding abortion rights before the end of August 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be marked as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Michigan officially carries out a public vote aimed at establishing protections for abortion rights within the state. For a positive outcome:

1. The public vote must be formally announced and executed by the Michigan state government.
2. The public vote must directly address the matter of abortion rights protection.
3. The outcomes of the public vote must be reported by official state channels or well-known news outlets.

This question will be marked as NO if:

1. No such public vote takes place by August 31, 2024.
2. A scheduled public vote is cancelled or delayed beyond the specified date.
3. A public vote occurs, but it does not specifically focus on establishing protections for abortion rights.

Note: This question does not take into account the results of the public vote, only whether it occurs within the given timeframe.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) An enforceable ethics code for U.S. Congress members be established by July 2024 and (2) Michigan hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met:

1. An enforceable ethics code specifically for U.S. Congress members is officially adopted by the United States government by July 31, 2024. The adoption must be confirmed by at least two major, reputable news outlets (such as The New York Times, The Washington Post, Reuters, or Associated Press). The ethics code must be legally binding and applicable to all sitting Congress members. It should outline clear standards of conduct and mechanisms for enforcement. If no such code meeting these criteria is established and officially adopted by the resolution date, this part of the question will resolve as NO. Note that mere proposals or discussions about such a code do not qualify for a YES resolution; the code must be formally adopted and enforceable.

2. Michigan officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state by August 31, 2024. For a positive resolution, the referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the Michigan state government, explicitly address the issue of abortion rights protection, and the results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources. The question will resolve as NO if no such referendum occurs by August 31, 2024, if a planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond the specified date, or if a referendum is held but does not specifically focus on enshrining protection for abortion rights. Note: This question does not consider the outcome of the referendum, only whether it takes place within the specified timeframe.

The question will resolve as NO if either or both of the above conditions are not met.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (1) By July 2024, a binding ethics code for members of the U.S. Congress will be put in place, and (2) Michigan will hold a vote on abortion rights by August 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with YES if both of the following criteria are satisfied:

1. A binding ethics code specifically for U.S. Congress members is officially enacted by the United States government by July 31, 2024. This enactment must be verified by at least two prominent, credible news organizations (such as The New York Times, The Washington Post, Reuters, or Associated Press). The ethics code must be legally enforceable and applicable to all current Congress members. It should delineate clear standards of behavior and enforcement mechanisms. If no such code that meets these requirements is established and officially enacted by the deadline, this portion of the inquiry will be answered with NO. It is important to note that mere proposals or discussions regarding such a code do not qualify for a YES answer; the code must be formally enacted and binding.

2. Michigan officially holds a public vote specifically aimed at establishing protection for abortion rights in the state by August 31, 2024. For a positive outcome, the vote must be officially declared and executed by the Michigan state government, explicitly addressing the matter of abortion rights protection, and the results must be reported publicly by official state channels or widely recognized news outlets. The inquiry will be answered with NO if no such vote occurs by August 31, 2024, if a planned vote is canceled or postponed beyond the specified date, or if a vote takes place but does not specifically aim at establishing protection for abortion rights. Note: This inquiry does not take into account the result of the vote, only whether it occurs within the designated timeframe.

The inquiry will be answered with NO if either or both of the above criteria are not fulfilled.

question.title: Will Google reach a settlement with the UK data protection authority by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Google and the UK data protection authority reach a formal settlement agreement regarding a fine imposed on Google for alleged data protection violations. The settlement must be confirmed by official statements from either party or reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or major national newspapers). The settlement should specifically address the fine imposed by the UK authority on Google. If no such settlement is reached or publicly confirmed by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. Note that appeals, ongoing negotiations, or partial settlements do not qualify for a YES resolution.

para_P.title: Will a resolution be achieved between Google and the UK data protection authority by the end of August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if, by August 31, 2024, a formal agreement is established between Google and the UK data protection authority concerning a penalty levied on Google for purported breaches of data protection laws. The agreement must be validated through official announcements from either side or covered by at least two credible news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or prominent national newspapers). The agreement should specifically pertain to the penalty imposed by the UK authority on Google. If such an agreement is not reached or publicly acknowledged by the deadline, the response will be negative. It is important to note that appeals, ongoing discussions, or incomplete agreements do not meet the criteria for a positive response.

question.title: Will the European Commission implement a significant tariff on Chinese-made solar panels by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the European Commission officially implements a tariff of 50% or higher on imports of Chinese-made solar panels. The implementation must be confirmed by official European Commission announcements and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, Financial Times, or The Economist). The tariff must be specifically targeted at solar panels manufactured in China and not part of a broader tariff on all Chinese goods or all electronic goods. If no such tariff meeting these criteria is implemented by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that the European Commission will establish a substantial tariff on solar panels produced in China by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, by the end of August 2024, the European Commission officially enacts a tariff of 50% or more on the importation of solar panels made in China. The confirmation of this implementation must come from official announcements by the European Commission and be reported by at least two prominent news organizations (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, Financial Times, or The Economist). The tariff must be explicitly aimed at solar panels that are manufactured in China and not part of a wider tariff affecting all Chinese products or all electronic items. If no such tariff that fulfills these criteria is enacted by the given deadline, the answer will be NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by August 2024: (a) Google will reach a settlement with the UK data protection authority, and (b) the European Commission will implement a significant tariff on Chinese-made solar panels?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met by August 31, 2024: (a) Google and the UK data protection authority reach a formal settlement agreement regarding a fine imposed on Google for alleged data protection violations. The settlement must be confirmed by official statements from either party or reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or major national newspapers). The settlement should specifically address the fine imposed by the UK authority on Google. If no such settlement is reached or publicly confirmed by the resolution date, this part resolves as NO. Note that appeals, ongoing negotiations, or partial settlements do not qualify for a YES resolution. (b) The European Commission officially implements a tariff of 50% or higher on imports of Chinese-made solar panels. The implementation must be confirmed by official European Commission announcements and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, Financial Times, or The Economist). The tariff must be specifically targeted at solar panels manufactured in China and not part of a broader tariff on all Chinese goods or all electronic goods. If no such tariff meeting these criteria is implemented by the specified date, this part resolves as NO. The entire question resolves as YES only if both (a) and (b) resolve as YES.

para_P.title: By August 2024, will both of the following take place: (a) a settlement is reached between Google and the UK data protection authority, and (b) the European Commission imposes a significant tariff on solar panels imported from China?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with YES if both of the subsequent conditions are fulfilled by August 31, 2024: (a) a formal settlement agreement is established between Google and the UK data protection authority concerning a penalty levied on Google for purported data protection infractions. This settlement must be validated by official announcements from either party or reported by a minimum of two credible news organizations (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or prominent national newspapers). The settlement must specifically pertain to the penalty imposed by the UK authority on Google. If such a settlement is not achieved or publicly acknowledged by the resolution date, this part will resolve as NO. It is important to note that appeals, ongoing discussions, or partial agreements do not qualify for a YES resolution. (b) the European Commission officially enacts a tariff of 50% or greater on imports of solar panels produced in China. The implementation must be confirmed by official announcements from the European Commission and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, Financial Times, or The Economist). The tariff must be specifically aimed at solar panels manufactured in China and not part of a wider tariff on all products from China or all electronic goods. If no such tariff that meets these criteria is enacted by the specified date, this part will resolve as NO. The overall question will resolve as YES only if both (a) and (b) resolve as YES.

question.title: Will Mercedes-Benz's quarterly net income increase by over 20% year-over-year by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if Mercedes-Benz reports a net income increase of more than 20% for any quarter compared to the same quarter in the previous year, in its official financial statements released by July 31, 2024. The increase must be verified through official company earnings reports or at least three credible financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal). If no such increase is reported by the resolution date, or if the highest reported increase is 20% or less, the question resolves as NO. Note that this question does not consider any specific quarter, but rather any quarter-over-quarter comparison within the specified timeframe.

para_P.title: By July 2024, will Mercedes-Benz's quarterly net profit rise by more than 20% compared to the same quarter from the previous year?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if Mercedes-Benz indicates a net profit rise exceeding 20% for any quarter when compared to the corresponding quarter from the previous year, as disclosed in its official financial statements by July 31, 2024. The increase must be confirmed through official earnings reports from the company or at least three reputable financial news outlets (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the Wall Street Journal). If no such rise is documented by the resolution date, or if the highest documented increase is 20% or lower, the inquiry will be resolved as NO. It is important to note that this question does not focus on any particular quarter, but rather any quarter-over-quarter evaluation within the defined period.

question.title: Will the Canadian economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Canadian economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by Statistics Canada. The question resolves as NO if the Canadian economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

para_P.title: Can Canada steer clear of a recession before July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if, by the end of July 2024, the Canadian economy remains free from a recession. A recession is characterized for this question as experiencing two successive quarters of declining GDP growth as documented by Statistics Canada. The answer will be negative if the Canadian economy faces two back-to-back quarters of negative GDP growth at any time from October 1, 2023, to July 31, 2024.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by July 2024: (1) Mercedes-Benz's quarterly net income increases by over 20% year-over-year, and (2) the Canadian economy avoids a recession?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met by July 31, 2024: (1) Mercedes-Benz reports a net income increase of more than 20% for any quarter compared to the same quarter in the previous year, in its official financial statements released by July 31, 2024. The increase must be verified through official company earnings reports or at least three credible financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal). If no such increase is reported by the resolution date, or if the highest reported increase is 20% or less, this part resolves as NO. Note that this part does not consider any specific quarter, but rather any quarter-over-quarter comparison within the specified timeframe. (2) The Canadian economy does not enter a recession by July 31, 2024. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by Statistics Canada. This part resolves as NO if the Canadian economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024. The overall question resolves as YES only if both conditions are satisfied.

para_P.title: By July 2024, will the following two events take place: (1) an increase of over 20% in Mercedes-Benz's quarterly net income year-over-year, and (2) the Canadian economy remains free of recession?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if both of the following criteria are fulfilled by July 31, 2024: (1) Mercedes-Benz must disclose a net income rise exceeding 20% for any quarter in comparison to the same quarter of the previous year, as stated in its official financial disclosures made available by July 31, 2024. This increase needs to be confirmed through official company earnings reports or at least three reputable financial news outlets (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal). If no such rise is reported by the resolution date, or if the highest reported increase is 20% or lower, this segment resolves as NO. It is important to note that this part does not focus on any specific quarter, but rather any quarter-over-quarter comparison within the given period. (2) The Canadian economy must not fall into a recession by July 31, 2024. For this question, a recession is characterized by two consecutive quarters of declining GDP growth as reported by Statistics Canada. This segment resolves as NO if the Canadian economy suffers two successive quarters of negative GDP growth at any time from October 1, 2023, to July 31, 2024. The overall question will only resolve as YES if both conditions are met.

question.title: Will the Central Bank of Brazil's Selic rate remain at or above 13.25% in August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Central Bank of Brazil's Selic rate is reported to be at or above 13.25% at any point during August 2024. Confirmation must come from official Central Bank of Brazil announcements or at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Folha de S.Paulo). If the rate is reported to have decreased below 13.25% and remains below this level throughout August 2024, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will Brazil's Central Bank keep its Selic rate at 13.25% or higher in August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a YES if the Selic rate set by Brazil's Central Bank is documented at or exceeding 13.25% at any time during August 2024. Verification must be obtained from official announcements by the Central Bank of Brazil or from at least two credible financial news outlets (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or Folha de S.Paulo). If the rate is reported to have fallen below 13.25% and stays under this threshold for the entire month of August 2024, the inquiry will be answered with a NO.

question.title: Will Argentine agricultural workers remain on strike through August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, agricultural workers in Argentina are still on strike or have not fully resumed normal operations following any current labor dispute. The status of the strike or work resumption must be confirmed by official statements from agricultural organizations, the unions representing the workers, or the Argentine government, and reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Clarín, La Nación, or Reuters). If the workers have fully returned to work and normal operations have resumed before or during August 2024, the question resolves as NO. Partial returns to work or limited operations do not count as a full resolution of the strike.

para_P.title: Will agricultural laborers in Argentina continue their strike until the end of August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, by August 31, 2024, agricultural laborers in Argentina are still engaged in a strike or have not completely resumed normal work activities following any ongoing labor conflict. The confirmation of the strike's status or the resumption of work must be validated by official announcements from agricultural associations, the unions that represent the workers, or the Argentine government, and reported by at least two credible news outlets (such as Clarín, La Nación, or Reuters). If the laborers have entirely returned to work and normal operations have been reinstated prior to or during August 2024, the answer will be NO. Any partial return to work or limited operational capacity does not constitute a full resolution of the strike.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The Central Bank of Brazil's Selic rate remains at or above 13.25% in August 2024, and (b) Argentine agricultural workers remain on strike through August 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) The Central Bank of Brazil's Selic rate is reported to be at or above 13.25% at any point during August 2024. Confirmation must come from official Central Bank of Brazil announcements or at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Folha de S.Paulo). If the rate is reported to have decreased below 13.25% and remains below this level throughout August 2024, this condition is not met.

(b) By August 31, 2024, agricultural workers in Argentina are still on strike or have not fully resumed normal operations following any current labor dispute. The status of the strike or work resumption must be confirmed by official statements from agricultural organizations, the unions representing the workers, or the Argentine government, and reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Clarín, La Nación, or Reuters). If the workers have fully returned to work and normal operations have resumed before or during August 2024, this condition is not met. Partial returns to work or limited operations do not count as a full resolution of the strike.

The question resolves as NO if either of these conditions is not met.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (a) The Selic rate set by the Central Bank of Brazil stays at or above 13.25% throughout August 2024, and (b) Argentine agricultural laborers continue their strike until the end of August 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with a YES if both of the following criteria are satisfied:

(a) The Selic rate of the Central Bank of Brazil is documented to be at or above 13.25% at any time during August 2024. Verification must be obtained from official announcements by the Central Bank of Brazil or from at least two credible financial news outlets (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Folha de S.Paulo). If the rate is noted to have fallen below 13.25% and stays under this threshold throughout August 2024, this criterion is not fulfilled.

(b) As of August 31, 2024, agricultural laborers in Argentina are still on strike or have not completely returned to regular operations following any ongoing labor dispute. The situation regarding the strike or the resumption of work must be verified by official communications from agricultural associations, the unions representing the workers, or the Argentine government, and reported by at least two trustworthy news organizations (such as Clarín, La Nación, or Reuters). If the workers have entirely resumed work and normal operations have been restored before or during August 2024, this criterion is not fulfilled. Partial work resumption or limited operations do not qualify as a complete end to the strike.

The question will be answered with a NO if either of these criteria is not satisfied.

question.title: Will Sony Corporation resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if Sony Corporation reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For the resolution to be considered valid:

1. The strike must involve a substantial number of Sony Corporation workers (at least 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must last for at least one week.
3. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Sony Corporation and the involved union.
4. The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will Sony Corporation come to an agreement to end a significant workers' strike by July 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered as YES if Sony Corporation successfully negotiates with union workers, leading to the conclusion of a major strike by July 31, 2024. For the outcome to be deemed valid:

1. The strike must involve a considerable number of employees from Sony Corporation (at least 1,000 participants).
2. The duration of the strike must be a minimum of one week.
3. The resolution must be validated by official announcements from both Sony Corporation and the relevant union.
4. The conclusion must be covered by at least two credible international news outlets (for instance, Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If no such agreement that meets all these conditions is reached by the designated date, or if no significant strike takes place, the inquiry resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the United States maintain a 100% tariff on Chinese-made machinery through August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, as of August 31, 2024, the United States continues to impose a 100% tariff on imports of Chinese-made machinery. The existence and rate of the tariff must be verifiable through official U.S. government sources (such as the Office of the United States Trade Representative or the U.S. Department of Commerce) and corroborated by at least two reputable news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, The Wall Street Journal, The New York Times). If the tariff is reduced below 100% or completely removed at any point up to and including August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Temporary suspensions or waivers of the tariff that are explicitly stated to be temporary and do not permanently alter the 100% rate will not affect the resolution of this question.

para_P.title: Will the U.S. uphold a full 100% tariff on machinery imported from China until August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if, by August 31, 2024, the U.S. persists in enforcing a 100% tariff on the importation of machinery from China. The presence and percentage of the tariff must be confirmed through official sources from the U.S. government (such as the Office of the United States Trade Representative or the U.S. Department of Commerce) and validated by at least two credible news outlets (for instance, Reuters, Bloomberg, The Wall Street Journal, The New York Times). Should the tariff be lowered below 100% or entirely eliminated at any time up to and including August 31, 2024, the inquiry will be deemed negative. Temporary suspensions or exemptions of the tariff that are clearly indicated as temporary and do not permanently modify the 100% rate will not influence the outcome of this inquiry.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Sony Corporation resolves a major workers' strike by July 2024 (b) The United States maintains a 100% tariff on Chinese-made machinery through August 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES only if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) Sony Corporation must reach an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For this resolution to be considered valid:
   1. The strike must involve at least 1,000 participants from Sony Corporation workers.
   2. The strike must last for at least one week.
   3. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Sony Corporation and the involved union.
   4. The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).
   If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, this part resolves as NO.

(b) As of August 31, 2024, the United States must continue to impose a 100% tariff on imports of Chinese-made machinery. The existence and rate of the tariff must be verifiable through official U.S. government sources (such as the Office of the United States Trade Representative or the U.S. Department of Commerce) and corroborated by at least two reputable news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, The Wall Street Journal, The New York Times). If the tariff is reduced below 100% or completely removed at any point up to and including August 31, 2024, this part resolves as NO. Temporary suspensions or waivers of the tariff that are explicitly stated to be temporary and do not permanently alter the 100% rate will not affect the resolution of this question.

The question resolves as NO if either or both of these conditions are not met.

para_P.title: Is it possible for both of the following to happen: (a) By July 2024, Sony Corporation successfully ends a significant workers' strike (b) The United States keeps a 100% tariff on machinery imported from China until August 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with YES only if both of the subsequent criteria are satisfied:

(a) Sony Corporation must finalize a deal with unionized employees, leading to the conclusion of a notable strike by July 31, 2024. For this resolution to be deemed valid:
   1. The strike should involve a minimum of 1,000 Sony Corporation workers.
   2. The strike must persist for no less than one week.
   3. The agreement must be validated by official announcements from both Sony Corporation and the relevant union.
   4. The resolution must be reported by at least two credible international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).
   If such a resolution that meets all these requirements is not achieved by the designated date, or if no significant strike takes place, this part resolves as NO.

(b) By August 31, 2024, the United States must sustain a 100% tariff on Chinese-made machinery imports. The presence and percentage of the tariff must be verifiable through official U.S. government channels (like the Office of the United States Trade Representative or the U.S. Department of Commerce) and confirmed by at least two trustworthy news agencies (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, The Wall Street Journal, The New York Times). If the tariff is lowered below 100% or entirely rescinded at any time up to and including August 31, 2024, this part resolves as NO. Temporary suspensions or waivers of the tariff explicitly labeled as temporary and not permanently changing the 100% rate will not influence the resolution of this question.

The question resolves as NO if either or both of these conditions fail to be fulfilled.

question.title: Will Sara Lee issue a recall of packaged meats due to a listeria outbreak by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Sara Lee officially announces a recall of any of its packaged meat products due to a listeria outbreak. The recall must be confirmed through at least one of the following sources:

1. An official announcement on Sara Lee's website or social media channels
2. A press release from Sara Lee
3. An announcement from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) specifically mentioning a Sara Lee recall
4. Reports from at least three major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, CNN, New York Times) citing official sources

The recall must explicitly mention listeria as the reason for the product withdrawal. If no such recall meeting these criteria is announced by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Facebook resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if Facebook reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For the resolution to be considered valid:

4. The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the question resolves as NO.

question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the government of Nigeria has not officially reversed its existing ban on cryptocurrency transactions. question.title: Will Russia's Federation Council pass a major economic reform bill opposed by President Putin by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Russia's Federation Council passes a major economic reform bill that is explicitly opposed by President Vladimir Putin or his administration. To qualify:

1. The bill must be related to economic policy, such as fiscal spending, taxation, or monetary policy.
2. It must be passed by the Federation Council, regardless of whether it becomes law.
3. The opposition from President Putin or his administration must be clearly reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
4. The bill must be described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the Russian economy.

If no such bill is passed by the Federation Council by August 31, 2024, or if a bill is passed but does not meet all the above criteria, the question resolves as NO.

2. It must be enacted by the Federation Council, irrespective of whether it is signed into law.
3. The opposition from President Putin or his administration must be explicitly reported by at least two prominent international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
4. The legislation must be characterized as 'major' or 'significant' by these news outlets concerning its potential effects on the Russian economy.

The opposition from President Putin or his administration must be clearly reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times). The bill must be described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the Russian economy. If no such bill is passed by the Federation Council by August 31, 2024, or if a bill is passed but does not meet all the above criteria, this condition is not met.

The question resolves as NO if either or both of these conditions are not met.

question.title: Will the Indonesian economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Indonesian economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by Statistics Indonesia. The question resolves as NO if the Indonesian economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

question.title: Will the WHO declare the Rift Valley fever outbreak in East Africa no longer a global emergency by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the World Health Organization (WHO) officially declares that the Rift Valley fever outbreak in East Africa is no longer considered a global emergency. For a YES resolution:

1. The WHO must make a public announcement explicitly stating that the Rift Valley fever outbreak in East Africa is no longer a global emergency.
2. This declaration must be reported by at least two major international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, CNN).
3. The declaration must specifically refer to the East African Rift Valley fever outbreak, not a global Rift Valley fever situation in general.

The question will resolve as NO if:
1. The WHO does not make such a declaration by August 31, 2024.
2. The WHO makes a declaration about Rift Valley fever that does not specifically address the East African outbreak.
3. The WHO maintains or escalates the emergency status of the East African Rift Valley fever outbreak.

Note: If the WHO has already declared the East African Rift Valley fever outbreak no longer a global emergency prior to this question's start date, the question will still resolve based on the status as of August 31, 2024.

2. This announcement must be covered by at least two prominent international news agencies (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, CNN).
3. The announcement must specifically mention the East African Rift Valley fever situation, rather than a general global situation regarding Rift Valley fever.

The inquiry will conclude as NO if:
1. The WHO fails to make such an announcement by August 31, 2024.
2. The WHO issues a statement regarding Rift Valley fever that does not specifically mention the East African situation.
3. The WHO continues or intensifies the emergency designation of the East African Rift Valley fever situation.

Note: If the WHO has previously declared the East African Rift Valley fever situation no longer a global emergency before the start date of this inquiry, the resolution will still be based on the status as of August 31, 2024.

question.title: Will General Motors resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if General Motors reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For the resolution to be considered valid:

2. The strike must last for at least one week.
3. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both General Motors and the involved union.
4. The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the question resolves as NO.

(a) LG Electronics comes to a settlement with unionized employees, leading to the conclusion of a major strike by July 31, 2024. For this segment to be considered YES:

   4. The settlement must be covered by at least two credible international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

(b) The average interest rate on a 30-year fixed mortgage in the United States, as indicated by Freddie Mac in their Primary Mortgage Market Survey, falls below 6.2% at any time before August 31, 2024. For this part to be YES:

The overall inquiry will be YES only if both (a) and (b) are confirmed as YES.

question.title: Will Russia report a successful winter crop season for wheat and barley by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Russia reports a successful winter crop season for wheat and barley, characterized by yields meeting or exceeding the average of the past five years. The success must be confirmed by official agricultural statistics from the Russian Ministry of Agriculture or at least three reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or The Economic Times). For this question, 'successful' is defined as the combined production of wheat and barley being at least 5% above the five-year average. If the winter crop season does not meet these criteria, or if insufficient data is available to make a determination, the question resolves as NO.

The announcement must be made through official company channels (such as press releases, investor relations statements, or official social media accounts) or reported by at least two major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, Wall Street Journal). The increase in AI-related workforce must be explicitly stated and not inferred from general hiring plans. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, or if Netflix only announces maintaining or decreasing its AI-related workforce, the question resolves as NO. Note that this question is about the announcement of plans, not the actual implementation of those plans.

para_P.title: Is Netflix going to reveal intentions to expand its AI workforce by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Netflix makes a public declaration regarding its intentions to grow its AI workforce. The declaration must occur through official corporate channels (such as press releases, statements to investors, or verified social media posts) or be covered by at least two prominent news organizations (like Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or the Wall Street Journal). The expansion of the AI workforce must be clearly articulated and not merely deduced from broader hiring strategies. If no such declaration is made by the given date, or if Netflix only states it will maintain or reduce its AI workforce, the inquiry will resolve as NO. It is important to note that this question pertains to the announcement of intentions, rather than the actual execution of those intentions.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Will Oregon receive over $300 million in federal grants for electric vehicle projects by July 2024? (b) Will Netflix announce plans to increase its AI-related workforce by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met by July 31, 2024: (a) The state of Oregon is confirmed to have been awarded more than $300 million in federal grants specifically for electric vehicle manufacturing, assembly, or related projects. Confirmation must come from official U.S. government sources (such as the Department of Energy or the White House) or be reported by at least two major national news organizations (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The grants must be explicitly designated for electric vehicle-related initiatives within Oregon. If the total amount of such grants awarded to Oregon does not exceed $300 million by the specified date, or if there is insufficient evidence to confirm such an award, this condition will resolve as NO. (b) Netflix publicly announces plans to increase its AI-related workforce. The announcement must be made through official company channels (such as press releases, investor relations statements, or official social media accounts) or reported by at least two major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, Wall Street Journal). The increase in AI-related workforce must be explicitly stated and not inferred from general hiring plans. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, or if Netflix only announces maintaining or decreasing its AI-related workforce, this condition resolves as NO. Note that this question is about the announcement of plans, not the actual implementation of those plans. If both conditions are satisfied, the combined question resolves as YES; otherwise, it resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Universal Studios Hollywood workers approve a new labor agreement by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the workers at Universal Studios Hollywood represented by the unions involved in recent negotiations approve a new labor agreement with Universal. The approval must be confirmed by official union announcements or reports from at least two reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The agreement in question must be related to the negotiations mentioned in recent news about avoiding a potential strike. If no such approval is confirmed by the resolution date, or if the agreement is rejected, the question resolves as NO.

The endorsement must be validated by official announcements from the unions or reports from at least two credible news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or prominent national newspapers). The contract in question must pertain to the negotiations referenced in recent news regarding the prevention of a potential strike. If such endorsement is not confirmed by the resolution date, or if the contract is turned down, the inquiry will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will the Central Bank of the Philippines announce an interest rate cut by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Central Bank of the Philippines officially announces an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed by official Bangko Sentral ng Pilipinas communications, such as press releases, Monetary Board statements, or public speeches by Bank officials. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. Note that the actual implementation date of the rate cut can be after August 31, 2024, as long as the announcement itself occurs by that date. The interest rate in question refers to the overnight reverse repurchase rate, which is the Central Bank of the Philippines' primary tool for monetary policy.

para_P.title: Will the Bangko Sentral ng Pilipinas declare a reduction in interest rates by the end of August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if the Bangko Sentral ng Pilipinas makes an official declaration regarding a reduction in interest rates that is set to take effect by August 31, 2024. The declaration must be validated through official communications from the Bangko Sentral ng Pilipinas, such as press releases, statements from the Monetary Board, or public addresses by Bank representatives. Should there be no such declaration by the specified resolution date, the inquiry will be deemed negative. It is important to note that the actual date of implementation for the interest rate reduction may occur after August 31, 2024, provided that the announcement itself is made by that date. The interest rate in question pertains to the overnight reverse repurchase rate, which serves as the primary monetary policy instrument of the Bangko Sentral ng Pilipinas.

question.title: Will Facebook implement court-ordered changes to its advertising policies by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Facebook implements any changes to its advertising policies as a result of a federal court ruling related to antitrust concerns. The implementation must be confirmed by official announcements from Facebook, court documents, or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, Wall Street Journal, or New York Times). Changes may include, but are not limited to, modifications in ad targeting, pricing models, or advertiser agreements. If no such changes are implemented and confirmed by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. Note that this question does not consider any appeals or stay orders that might delay the implementation of changes.

question.body:

question.title: Will Hillshire Farm issue a recall of sausage products due to a listeria outbreak by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Hillshire Farm officially announces a recall of any of its sausage products due to a listeria outbreak. The recall must be confirmed through at least one of the following sources:

1. An official announcement on Hillshire Farm's website or social media channels
2. A press release from Hillshire Farm
3. An announcement from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) specifically mentioning a Hillshire Farm recall
4. Reports from at least three major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, CNN, New York Times) citing official sources

The recall must explicitly mention listeria as the reason for the product withdrawal. If no such recall meeting these criteria is announced by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will the FDA issue a recall for ground ginger products due to lead contamination by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) officially issues a recall for any ground ginger products due to lead contamination. The recall must be confirmed through official FDA announcements or reports from at least two major news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Washington Post). A recall is defined as a formal request by the FDA for manufacturers to remove their products from the market. Warnings or alerts without an official recall do not qualify for a YES resolution. If no such recall is issued by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

This inquiry will conclude as YES if both of the following conditions are satisfied: (a) By August 31, 2024, New York carries out a public vote aimed specifically at solidifying abortion rights protections in the state. For a YES outcome, the following conditions must be fulfilled:

1. The vote must be officially declared and executed by the state of New York.
2. The main focus of the vote must be on the protection of abortion rights.
3. The results of the vote must be made public through official state channels or widely accepted news outlets.

If no such vote that meets these criteria occurs by August 31, 2024, the inquiry will conclude as NO. It is important to note that merely suggesting or planning a vote without actually carrying it out by the specified date does not qualify for a YES outcome.

(b) By July 31, 2024, New Jersey must conduct a vote regarding the inclusion of affordable housing in its state constitution. This must be verified through official state announcements or coverage by at least two credible national news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Washington Post, or CNN). The vote must specifically focus on the safeguarding of affordable housing within the state constitution. If no such vote is held by the resolution date, or if the vote does not specifically address the constitutional protection of affordable housing, the inquiry will conclude as NO.

question.title: Will the United States maintain a 100% tariff on Chinese-made textiles through August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, as of August 31, 2024, the United States continues to impose a 100% tariff on imports of Chinese-made textiles. The existence and rate of the tariff must be verifiable through official U.S. government sources (such as the Office of the United States Trade Representative or the U.S. Department of Commerce) and corroborated by at least two reputable news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, The Wall Street Journal, The New York Times). If the tariff is reduced below 100% or completely removed at any point up to and including August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Temporary suspensions or waivers of the tariff that are explicitly stated to be temporary and do not permanently alter the 100% rate will not affect the resolution of this question.
