question.title: Will the Central Bank of South Korea announce a new digital payment system by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the Central Bank of South Korea officially announces the launch of a new digital payment system. The announcement must come from an official Central Bank of South Korea communication channel, such as a press release or a public speech by the Governor of the Central Bank of South Korea. The announcement should explicitly state the introduction of the digital payment system. The announcement must be reported by at least two major financial news outlets (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC, Financial Times) to be considered valid. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, or if the Central Bank of South Korea does not announce a new digital payment system, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will South Korea's Central Bank unveil a new digital payment system before the end of August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed YES if, by August 31, 2024, the Central Bank of South Korea formally reveals the launch of a new digital payment system. The declaration must originate from an official communication channel of the Central Bank of South Korea, such as a press release or a public address by the Governor of the Central Bank. The announcement should clearly indicate the introduction of the digital payment system. Furthermore, the announcement must be covered by at least two prominent financial news organizations (for example, Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC, Financial Times) to be considered legitimate. If no such declaration occurs by the specified deadline, or if the Central Bank of South Korea does not disclose a new digital payment system, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will the Central Bank of Mexico announce an interest rate cut by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Central Bank of Mexico officially announces a decrease in its target for the overnight interbank interest rate by July 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the Central Bank of Mexico or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Board of Governors and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual Central Bank of Mexico members will not count for resolution. If no such official announcement of an interest rate cut is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is it expected that the Central Bank of Mexico will declare a reduction in interest rates by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed affirmative if the Central Bank of Mexico publicly declares a reduction in its target for the overnight interbank interest rate by July 31, 2024. The declaration must be verified through official communications from the Central Bank of Mexico or reported by a minimum of two prominent financial news outlets (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate reduction must be a formal resolution made by the Board of Governors and conveyed in their official statement or press briefing following a meeting. Any conjecture regarding potential future rate reductions or unofficial remarks by individual members of the Central Bank of Mexico will not be considered for resolution. If no such formal announcement regarding an interest rate reduction is made by the specified resolution date, the inquiry will be resolved negatively.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) The Central Bank of South Korea announces a new digital payment system by August 2024, and (2) The Central Bank of Mexico announces an interest rate cut by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met: (1) By August 31, 2024, the Central Bank of South Korea officially announces the launch of a new digital payment system. The announcement must be made through an official Central Bank of South Korea communication channel, such as a press release or a public speech by the Governor, and must be reported by at least two major financial news outlets (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC, Financial Times). (2) By July 31, 2024, the Central Bank of Mexico officially announces a decrease in its target for the overnight interbank interest rate. This announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the Central Bank of Mexico or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC), and must be a formal decision made by the Board of Governors and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. If both conditions are met by their respective dates, the question resolves as YES; otherwise, it resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Are both of these events going to take place: (1) The Central Bank of South Korea will declare a new digital payment system by August 2024, and (2) The Central Bank of Mexico will implement an interest rate reduction by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if both of the following criteria are satisfied: (1) By August 31, 2024, the Central Bank of South Korea formally announces the introduction of a new digital payment system. This announcement must occur via an official communication channel of the Central Bank of South Korea, such as a press release or a public address by the Governor, and should be covered by at least two prominent financial news outlets (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC, Financial Times). (2) By July 31, 2024, the Central Bank of Mexico officially declares a reduction in its target for the overnight interbank interest rate. This declaration must be validated through official communications from the Central Bank of Mexico or reported by at least two major financial news organizations (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC), and must represent a formal decision made by the Board of Governors, communicated in their official statement or during a press conference after a meeting. If both criteria are fulfilled by their respective deadlines, the question will resolve as YES; otherwise, it will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Virginia's Medicaid plan with work requirements enroll at least 25,000 beneficiaries by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Virginia's Medicaid plan, which includes a work requirement, has enrolled at least 25,000 low-income residents. Enrollment figures must be confirmed by official state reports, the Virginia Department of Medical Assistance Services, or at least three widely recognized news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The plan must maintain its work requirement feature throughout the period. If the enrollment is below 25,000 by the resolution date, or if the work requirement is removed from the plan, the question resolves as NO. In case of any legal challenges or federal interventions that significantly alter the plan's structure or implementation, the question will still resolve based on the enrollment numbers of the original plan or its closest equivalent.

para_P.title: By July 2024, will at least 25,000 individuals be enrolled in Virginia's Medicaid program that includes work requirements?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, by July 31, 2024, Virginia's Medicaid program, which has a work requirement, enrolls no fewer than 25,000 low-income individuals. Enrollment numbers must be validated by official state documentation, the Virginia Department of Medical Assistance Services, or a minimum of three reputable news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The work requirement must remain a part of the program throughout this timeframe. If the enrollment falls short of 25,000 by the resolution date, or if the work requirement is eliminated from the program, the answer will be NO. Additionally, if there are any legal disputes or federal actions that significantly modify the program's framework or execution, the resolution will still be based on the enrollment figures of the original program or its closest equivalent.

question.title: Will Apple Inc. resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if Apple Inc. reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For the resolution to be considered valid:

1. The strike must involve a substantial number of Apple Inc. workers (at least 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must last for at least one week.
3. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Apple Inc. and the involved union.
4. The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will Apple Inc. come to an agreement to end a significant strike by July 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with a YES if Apple Inc. successfully negotiates with unionized employees, leading to the conclusion of a major strike by July 31, 2024. For the answer to be deemed valid:

1. The strike must include a considerable number of Apple Inc. employees (a minimum of 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must continue for at least one week.
3. Confirmation of the resolution must come from official communications from both Apple Inc. and the participating union.
4. The resolution must be reported by at least two credible international news outlets (such as Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If no resolution satisfying all these conditions is reached by the deadline, or if no significant strike takes place, the answer will be NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by July 2024: (a) Virginia's Medicaid plan with work requirements enrolls at least 25,000 beneficiaries, and (b) Apple Inc. resolves a major workers' strike?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met by July 31, 2024:

(a) Virginia's Medicaid plan, which includes a work requirement, enrolls at least 25,000 low-income residents. Enrollment figures must be confirmed by official state reports, the Virginia Department of Medical Assistance Services, or at least three widely recognized news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The plan must maintain its work requirement feature throughout the period. If the enrollment is below 25,000 by the resolution date, or if the work requirement is removed from the plan, the condition is not met. In case of any legal challenges or federal interventions that significantly alter the plan's structure or implementation, the condition will still be evaluated based on the enrollment numbers of the original plan or its closest equivalent.

(b) Apple Inc. reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike. The strike must involve a substantial number of Apple Inc. workers (at least 1,000 participants) and last for at least one week. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Apple Inc. and the involved union, and reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC). If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the condition is not met.

The question resolves as NO if either or both of these conditions are not met.

para_P.title: By July 2024, will both of these events take place: (a) Virginia's Medicaid program with work requirements enrolls a minimum of 25,000 beneficiaries, and (b) Apple Inc. successfully concludes a major workers' strike?
para_P.body:
This inquiry is answered with YES if both of the following criteria are satisfied by July 31, 2024:

(a) Virginia's Medicaid program, which incorporates a work requirement, enrolls no fewer than 25,000 low-income individuals. Enrollment statistics must be validated by official state reports, the Virginia Department of Medical Assistance Services, or at least three reputable news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The work requirement aspect of the program must remain intact throughout the entire period. If the enrollment falls short of 25,000 by the resolution date, or if the work requirement is eliminated from the program, this condition is not fulfilled. In the event of any legal disputes or federal actions that significantly modify the program's structure or execution, the evaluation will still rely on the enrollment figures of the original program or its closest equivalent.

(b) Apple Inc. comes to a resolution with unionized employees, leading to the conclusion of a significant strike. The strike must involve a considerable number of Apple Inc. workers (at least 1,000 participants) and persist for a minimum of one week. Confirmation of the resolution must come from official announcements by both Apple Inc. and the relevant union, and be reported by at least two credible international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC). If such a resolution meeting all these requirements is not achieved by the designated date, or if no substantial strike takes place, this condition is not fulfilled.

The question is resolved as NO if either or both of these conditions are not satisfied.

question.title: Will Louisiana's near-total abortion ban be declared constitutional by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, a court ruling confirms the constitutionality of Louisiana's near-total abortion ban. The confirmation must come from a Louisiana state court and be reported by at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major US newspapers). If the ban is not declared constitutional by the specified date, or if a court rules it unconstitutional, the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, a 'near-total abortion ban' refers to the law that was blocked and is pending assessment, as mentioned in the article dated October 1, 2023.

para_P.title: By August 2024, will a court affirm the constitutionality of Louisiana's near-total abortion prohibition?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with YES if, by August 31, 2024, a judicial decision validates the constitutionality of Louisiana's near-total abortion prohibition. The affirmation must originate from a Louisiana state court and be reported by at least two credible national news outlets (like Associated Press, Reuters, or prominent US newspapers). If the prohibition is not affirmed as constitutional by the indicated date, or if a court finds it unconstitutional, the answer will be NO. For the purposes of this inquiry, a 'near-total abortion prohibition' pertains to the law that was halted and is awaiting evaluation, as referenced in the article dated October 1, 2023.

question.title: Will Missouri conduct a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Missouri conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a YES resolution, the following criteria must be met:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of Missouri.
2. The primary focus of the referendum must be on abortion rights protection.
3. The referendum results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

If no such referendum meeting these criteria occurs by August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that merely proposing or planning a referendum without actually conducting it by the specified date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

para_P.title: Is there a plan for Missouri to hold a vote on abortion rights before August 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with YES if, by August 31, 2024, Missouri holds a public vote aimed at establishing protections for abortion rights within the state. For a YES answer, the following conditions must be fulfilled:

1. The vote must be officially declared and carried out by the state of Missouri.
2. The main emphasis of the vote must be on safeguarding abortion rights.
3. The outcomes of the vote must be publicly disclosed by official state sources or widely acknowledged news outlets.

If no such vote that meets these conditions takes place by August 31, 2024, the inquiry will be answered with NO. It is important to note that simply suggesting or planning a vote without actually holding it by the given date does not qualify for a YES answer.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by August 2024: (a) Louisiana's near-total abortion ban be declared constitutional and (b) Missouri conduct a referendum on abortion rights?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met by August 31, 2024:

(a) Louisiana's near-total abortion ban is declared constitutional by a Louisiana state court, with the confirmation reported by at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major US newspapers). The ban refers to the law that was blocked and is pending assessment as mentioned in the article dated October 1, 2023.

(b) Missouri conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of Missouri, with the primary focus on abortion rights protection, and the results publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

If either condition (a) or (b) is not met by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: By August 2024, will both of the following take place: (a) the constitutionality of Louisiana's near-total abortion ban be affirmed, and (b) Missouri hold a referendum concerning abortion rights?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with YES if both of the following criteria are satisfied by August 31, 2024:

(a) A Louisiana state court affirms the constitutionality of the near-total abortion ban, with this confirmation reported by at least two credible national news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major US newspapers). The ban pertains to the law that was previously blocked and is under review as referenced in the article dated October 1, 2023.

(b) Missouri carries out a public referendum aimed specifically at establishing protections for abortion rights. This referendum must be officially declared and executed by the state of Missouri, concentrating on the protection of abortion rights, with the outcomes publicly disclosed by official state channels or widely recognized news organizations.

If either criterion (a) or (b) is not fulfilled by the indicated date, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Pedro Sánchez remain the Prime Minister of Spain through July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if Pedro Sánchez continues to hold the position of Prime Minister of Spain through July 31, 2024. Confirmation must come from official Spanish government records or credible news reports from at least two major news organizations (e.g., El País, El Mundo, Reuters, AFP). The question will resolve as NO if Sánchez leaves or is removed from the position at any point before or during July 2024. For the purpose of this question, temporary absences due to illness or vacation do not count as leaving the position.

para_P.title: Will Pedro Sánchez stay in office as the Prime Minister of Spain until the end of July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if Pedro Sánchez remains in the role of Prime Minister of Spain until July 31, 2024. The answer will be NO if Sánchez departs from or is ousted from his position at any time before or during July 2024. For the purposes of this inquiry, temporary leaves due to illness or vacation are not considered as leaving the office.

question.title: Will Boris Johnson remain the Prime Minister of the UK through July 2024?

para_P.title: Will Pedro Sánchez and Boris Johnson both continue to serve as Prime Ministers of their respective nations until July 2024?

question.title: Will China's central bank's preferred inflation measure show a monthly increase exceeding 0.5% by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if China's central bank's preferred inflation measure reports a month-over-month increase greater than 0.5% in any single month between October 2023 and July 31, 2024. The increase must be officially published by the People's Bank of China or a relevant Chinese government agency and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, South China Morning Post). If no such increase is reported during this period, the question will resolve as NO. Note that this question focuses on the month-over-month change, not year-over-year or any other time frame.

para_P.title: By July 2024, will the inflation metric favored by China's central bank experience a monthly rise surpassing 0.5%?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if the inflation metric favored by China's central bank indicates a month-over-month increase exceeding 0.5% in any month from October 2023 through July 31, 2024. The increase must be officially documented by the People's Bank of China or a relevant governmental body in China and reported by at least two credible financial news outlets (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or South China Morning Post). If there is no such increase reported in this timeframe, the answer will be NO. It is important to note that this question pertains specifically to the month-over-month variation, rather than year-over-year or any other duration.

question.title: Will Samsung announce plans to increase its AI-related workforce by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Samsung publicly announces plans to increase its AI-related workforce. The announcement must be made through official company channels (such as press releases, investor relations statements, or official social media accounts) or reported by at least two major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, Wall Street Journal). The increase in AI-related workforce must be explicitly stated and not inferred from general hiring plans. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, or if Samsung only announces maintaining or decreasing its AI-related workforce, the question resolves as NO. Note that this question is about the announcement of plans, not the actual implementation of those plans.

para_P.title: Will Samsung reveal intentions to expand its workforce focused on AI by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be resolved as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Samsung makes a public declaration regarding its intentions to expand its workforce dedicated to AI. The declaration must be issued through official company channels (such as press releases, statements to investors, or official social media platforms) or reported by at least two prominent news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, Wall Street Journal). The expansion of the AI-related workforce must be explicitly mentioned and not merely inferred from general hiring strategies. If no such declaration is made by the specified date, or if Samsung only indicates a decision to maintain or reduce its AI-related workforce, the inquiry will resolve as NO. It is important to note that this question pertains to the announcement of intentions, rather than the actual execution of those intentions.

para_P.title: Is it possible that by July 2024, both of the following will happen: (a) China's central bank's preferred inflation metric indicates a monthly rise surpassing 0.5%, and (b) Samsung reveals intentions to expand its workforce focused on AI?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed YES if both of the subsequent criteria are satisfied by July 31, 2024: (a) China's central bank's preferred inflation metric shows a month-over-month rise exceeding 0.5% in any month from October 2023 to July 31, 2024. This increase must be officially reported by the People's Bank of China or an appropriate Chinese governmental body and covered by at least two credible financial news outlets (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the South China Morning Post). The increase in the AI workforce must be clearly articulated and not merely implied from broader hiring strategies. If either of these conditions is unmet by the designated date, the inquiry resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Green Acres Co. be officially linked to a new salmonella outbreak by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Green Acres Co. is officially linked to a new salmonella outbreak that is different from any previously reported outbreaks. The link must be confirmed by U.S. federal health officials (such as the CDC or FDA) and reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Washington Post). The outbreak must be traced back to products from Green Acres Co. and must have occurred after October 1, 2023. If no such new outbreak is linked to Green Acres Co. by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will Green Acres Co. be connected to a new salmonella outbreak by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Green Acres Co. is confirmed to be associated with a new salmonella outbreak that is distinct from any previously documented outbreaks. question.title: Will the FDA issue a recall for ground basil products due to lead contamination by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) officially issues a recall for any ground basil products due to lead contamination. The recall must be confirmed through official FDA announcements or reports from at least two major news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Washington Post). A recall is defined as a formal request by the FDA for manufacturers to remove their products from the market. Warnings or alerts without an official recall do not qualify for a YES resolution. If no such recall is issued by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that the FDA will recall ground basil products because of lead contamination by July 2024?

A recall is characterized as an official request from the FDA for manufacturers to withdraw their products from the market. Alerts or warnings that do not include an official recall do not count for a YES answer. If there is no recall issued by the specified resolution date, the question will be answered as NO.

question.title: Will Nigeria's Senate pass a major economic reform bill opposed by President Tinubu by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Nigeria's Senate passes a major economic reform bill that is explicitly opposed by President Bola Tinubu or his administration. To qualify:

1. The bill must be related to economic policy, such as fiscal spending, taxation, or monetary policy.
2. It must be passed by the Senate, regardless of whether it becomes law.
3. The opposition from President Tinubu or his administration must be clearly reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
4. The bill must be described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the Nigerian economy.

If no such bill is passed by the Senate by August 31, 2024, or if a bill is passed but does not meet all the above criteria, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will the Senate of Nigeria approve a significant economic reform legislation that President Tinubu is against by the end of August 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with YES if, by August 31, 2024, the Senate of Nigeria approves a significant economic reform legislation that is openly opposed by President Bola Tinubu or his administration. To be considered:

1. The legislation must pertain to economic policy matters, including fiscal spending, taxation, or monetary policy.
2. It must receive Senate approval, irrespective of whether it becomes law.
3. The opposition from President Tinubu or his administration must be distinctly reported by a minimum of two prominent international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
4. The legislation must be characterized as 'major' or 'significant' by these news outlets regarding its potential effects on the Nigerian economy.

If no such legislation is approved by the Senate by August 31, 2024, or if a legislation is approved but fails to satisfy all the aforementioned criteria, the inquiry will resolve as NO.

question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Bayer officially announces or confirms that it will allow generic production of its cardiovascular drug, effectively not enforcing its patent. This could be through a formal patent withdrawal, a voluntary license agreement, or any other mechanism that allows for unrestricted generic production. Confirmation must come from official company announcements, statements from relevant regulatory bodies, or reports by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers). If no such announcement or confirmation is made by the specified date, or if Bayer continues to enforce its patent rights, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will TikTok's AI-driven content recommendations be reported for spreading election misinformation by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that TikTok's AI-driven content recommendations are spreading election misinformation. For the purpose of this question, 'election misinformation' refers to false or misleading information about election processes, candidates, or results. Credible reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. The reports or warnings must specifically mention TikTok's AI and its role in spreading election misinformation. If no such reports or warnings are issued by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will the Chinese battery company's factory project in Michigan be canceled by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, it is confirmed that the Chinese lithium-ion battery company's plan to build a $2.36 billion factory in Big Rapids, Michigan has been officially canceled. Confirmation must come from official statements by the company, the state of Michigan, or at least two credible news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The cancellation must be a complete termination of the project, not just a delay or modification. If the project is still ongoing, under review, or has not been officially canceled by this date, the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, 'cancellation' means the company has formally withdrawn its plans or the state has definitively rejected the project.

question.title: Will Colorado's near-total abortion ban be declared constitutional by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, a court ruling confirms the constitutionality of Colorado's near-total abortion ban. The confirmation must come from a Colorado state court and be reported by at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major US newspapers). If the ban is not declared constitutional by the specified date, or if a court rules it unconstitutional, the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, a 'near-total abortion ban' refers to the law that was blocked and is pending assessment, as mentioned in the article dated October 1, 2023.

para_P.title: Will the constitutionality of Colorado's near-total abortion prohibition be affirmed by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as YES if, by August 31, 2024, a judicial decision validates the constitutionality of Colorado's near-total abortion prohibition. question.title: Will Rhode Island maintain its red flag law through August 2024?

para_P.title: Will Rhode Island uphold its red flag legislation until August 2024?

question.title: Will Spain eliminate export taxes on agricultural products by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Spanish government officially announces or implements a policy to completely eliminate export taxes on agricultural products. The policy must be confirmed by official government communications or reported by at least two reputable international news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or Associated Press). Partial reductions in export taxes or the elimination of taxes on only some agricultural products will not be sufficient for a YES resolution. If no such policy is introduced or implemented by the resolution date, or if only partial measures are taken, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will Spain abolish export duties on farm products before July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Spanish authorities officially declare or enact a policy to entirely remove export duties on farm products. The policy must be validated by official government announcements or covered by at least two credible international news organizations (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or Associated Press). Mere reductions in export duties or the removal of duties on only certain farm products will not suffice for a YES answer. If no such policy is introduced or enacted by the resolution date, or if only partial actions are taken, the question will be answered with a NO.

question.title: Will the United States report a bumper harvest for both corn and soybeans by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the United States officially reports a bumper harvest for both corn and soybeans, indicating higher than average yields compared to the previous five-year average. A bumper harvest is defined as a crop yield that is significantly above average, typically at least 10% higher than the five-year average. Confirmation must come from official reports by the United States Department of Agriculture (USDA) or at least three reputable news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or The Wall Street Journal). If a bumper harvest is reported for only one of the crops (either corn or soybeans) but not both, or if no bumper harvest is reported for either crop, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will there be a significant increase in the harvest of both corn and soybeans in the United States by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the United States officially announces a significant increase in the harvest of both corn and soybeans, reflecting yields that are above the average compared to the last five years. A significant increase in harvest is characterized as a crop yield that is considerably above the average, generally at least 10% higher than the five-year average. Verification must be provided by official announcements from the United States Department of Agriculture (USDA) or at least three credible news organizations (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or The Wall Street Journal). If a significant increase in harvest is reported for just one of the crops (either corn or soybeans) but not for both, or if no significant increase is reported for either crop, the inquiry will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Spain eliminate export taxes on agricultural products by July 2024 AND will the United States report a bumper harvest for both corn and soybeans by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following occur: (1) By July 31, 2024, the Spanish government officially announces or implements a policy to completely eliminate export taxes on agricultural products. The policy must be confirmed by official government communications or reported by at least two reputable international news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or Associated Press). Partial reductions in export taxes or the elimination of taxes on only some agricultural products will not be sufficient for a YES resolution. (2) By August 31, 2024, the United States officially reports a bumper harvest for both corn and soybeans, indicating higher than average yields compared to the previous five-year average. A bumper harvest is defined as a crop yield that is significantly above average, typically at least 10% higher than the five-year average. Confirmation must come from official reports by the United States Department of Agriculture (USDA) or at least three reputable news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or The Wall Street Journal). The question resolves as NO if either or both of these conditions are not met.

para_P.title: Will Spain abolish export duties on agricultural goods by July 2024 AND will the United States announce an exceptional harvest for both corn and soybeans by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if both of the subsequent conditions are satisfied: (1) By July 31, 2024, the Spanish government makes an official declaration or enacts a policy to fully abolish export duties on agricultural goods. This policy must be validated by official government statements or reported by at least two credible international news organizations (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or Associated Press). Any partial cuts in export duties or the removal of duties on only specific agricultural products will not suffice for a YES outcome. (2) By August 31, 2024, the United States officially announces an exceptional harvest for both corn and soybeans, reflecting yields that are significantly above the average compared to the last five years. An exceptional harvest is characterized by a crop yield that is notably higher than average, generally at least 10% more than the five-year average. Confirmation must be provided by official reports from the United States Department of Agriculture (USDA) or at least three reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or The Wall Street Journal). The question will be resolved as NO if either or both of these criteria are not fulfilled.

question.title: Will the Central Bank of Indonesia announce a new monetary easing policy by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the Central Bank of Indonesia officially announces a new monetary easing policy. The announcement must come from an official Central Bank of Indonesia communication channel, such as a press release or a public speech by the Governor of the Central Bank of Indonesia. The announcement should explicitly describe the new monetary easing policy. The announcement must be reported by at least two major financial news outlets (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC, Financial Times) to be considered valid. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, or if the Central Bank of Indonesia maintains the current policy stance, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that the Central Bank of Indonesia will introduce a new monetary easing policy before August 2024?

If such a declaration is not made by the stated date, or if the Central Bank of Indonesia continues with the existing policy, the inquiry will be considered negative.

question.title: Will the Singapore Straits Times Index reach or exceed 4,000 points by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, at any point between October 1, 2023 and August 31, 2024, the Singapore Straits Times Index reaches or exceeds 4,000 points. The 4,000 point level is chosen as a representative value that the index might have been at before a significant drop. Verification will be based on official index reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the Singapore Exchange. If the index does not reach 4,000 points during this period, the question resolves as NO. Note that intraday highs count for resolution; the index does not need to close at or above 4,000 points.

para_P.title: Will the Singapore Straits Times Index hit or surpass 4,000 points by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, at any time from October 1, 2023, to August 31, 2024, the Singapore Straits Times Index hits or surpasses the 4,000 points mark. The 4,000 point threshold is selected as a significant value that the index may have reached before experiencing a notable decline. Confirmation will rely on official index data from trusted financial market information sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the Singapore Exchange. If the index does not reach the 4,000 points level during this timeframe, the outcome will be NO. It is important to note that intraday peaks are considered for this resolution; the index does not have to close at or above 4,000 points.

question.body:
(a) The Central Bank of Indonesia must officially announce a new monetary easing policy by August 31, 2024. This announcement should come from an official Central Bank of Indonesia communication channel, such as a press release or a public speech by the Governor of the Central Bank of Indonesia, and explicitly describe the new monetary easing policy. It must be reported by at least two major financial news outlets (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC, Financial Times) to be valid. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, or if the Central Bank of Indonesia maintains the current policy stance, this condition resolves as NO.

(b) The Singapore Straits Times Index must reach or exceed 4,000 points at any point between October 1, 2023, and August 31, 2024. Verification will be based on official index reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the Singapore Exchange. Intraday highs count for resolution; the index does not need to close at or above 4,000 points. If the index does not reach 4,000 points during this period, this condition resolves as NO.

The overall question resolves as YES only if both (a) and (b) occur as described.

para_P.title: Is it possible that by August 2024, both the Central Bank of Indonesia will declare a new monetary easing policy and the Singapore Straits Times Index will hit or surpass 4,000 points?
para_P.body:
(a) A declaration of a new monetary easing policy by the Central Bank of Indonesia must be made officially by August 31, 2024. This declaration should be communicated through an official channel of the Central Bank of Indonesia, such as a press release or a public address by the Governor, and must clearly outline the new monetary easing policy. It must also be reported by at least two prominent financial news organizations (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC, Financial Times) to be considered valid. (b) The Singapore Straits Times Index needs to reach or exceed 4,000 points at any time between October 1, 2023, and August 31, 2024. This will be confirmed through official index reports from credible financial market data sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the Singapore Exchange. Intraday peaks will count for this condition; the index does not have to finish at or above 4,000 points. If the index fails to reach 4,000 points within this timeframe, this condition will also resolve as NO.

The overall inquiry will only be answered with YES if both conditions (a) and (b) are met as specified.

question.title: Will the World Health Organization declare the current West Nile virus outbreak over by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the World Health Organization (WHO) officially declares the ongoing West Nile virus outbreak over by August 31, 2024. The declaration must be confirmed through official WHO announcements or reports from at least three reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC). The outbreak referred to in this question is the one that prompted heightened public health responses globally. If no such declaration ending the outbreak is made by the resolution date, or if the WHO extends the emergency status beyond August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Will the World Health Organization announce the conclusion of the present West Nile virus epidemic by August 2024?

The epidemic in question is the one that led to increased global public health measures. In the event that such a declaration is not made by the resolution date, or if the WHO prolongs the emergency status past August 31, 2024, the inquiry will be deemed as NO.

question.title: Will Land O'Frost issue a recall of deli meats due to a listeria outbreak by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Land O'Frost officially announces a recall of any of its deli meat products due to a listeria outbreak. The recall must be confirmed through at least one of the following sources:

1. An official announcement on Land O'Frost's website or social media channels
2. A press release from Land O'Frost
3. An announcement from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) specifically mentioning a Land O'Frost recall
4. Reports from at least three major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, CNN, New York Times) citing official sources

The recall must explicitly mention listeria as the reason for the product withdrawal. If no such recall meeting these criteria is announced by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Land O'Frost will recall deli meats due to a listeria outbreak before August 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be deemed TRUE if, by August 31, 2024, Land O'Frost makes an official statement regarding the recall of any of its deli meat items because of a listeria outbreak. The recall must be validated through at least one of the following means:

1. A formal declaration on Land O'Frost's official website or social media platforms
2. A public announcement from Land O'Frost
3. A notification from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) that specifically references a recall by Land O'Frost
4. Coverage from a minimum of three prominent news organizations (such as Reuters, Associated Press, CNN, New York Times) citing credible sources

The recall must clearly state listeria as the cause for the withdrawal of the products. If no such recall that meets these conditions is made by the given date, the inquiry will be resolved as FALSE.

The outbreak referred to in this question is the one that prompted heightened public health responses globally. 1. An official announcement on Land O'Frost's website or social media channels
2. A press release from Land O'Frost
3. An announcement from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) specifically mentioning a Land O'Frost recall
4. Reports from at least three major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, CNN, New York Times) citing official sources

The recall must explicitly mention listeria as the reason for the product withdrawal. If no such recall meeting these criteria is announced by the specified date, this part will resolve as NO.

The overall question will resolve as YES only if both parts (a) and (b) resolve as YES by the specified date.

para_P.title: By August 2024, will the following two events take place: (a) The World Health Organization announces the end of the current West Nile virus outbreak, and (b) Land O'Frost recalls deli meats due to a listeria outbreak?
para_P.body:

This declaration must be validated through official announcements from the WHO or reports from a minimum of three credible news organizations (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC). The outbreak in question is the one that led to increased public health measures worldwide. (b) Land O'Frost makes an official statement regarding the recall of any of its deli meat products due to a listeria outbreak. This recall must be corroborated by at least one of the following sources:

1. An official announcement on Land O'Frost's website or social media platforms
2. A press release issued by Land O'Frost
3. An announcement from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) that specifically mentions a Land O'Frost recall
4. Reports from at least three major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, CNN, New York Times) that cite official sources

question.title: Will the average rate on a 15-year mortgage in the US fall below 5.0% by August 2024?

question.title: Will Missouri hold a referendum on abortion rights by July 2024?

The referendum must be open to all eligible voters in Missouri and focus primarily on abortion rights. question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Iowa's law banning most abortions after approximately six weeks of pregnancy is either repealed by the state legislature or invalidated by a court ruling. For the purpose of this question, 'overturned' means the law is no longer enforceable in its current form, either through legislative action or judicial decision.

question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that a major social media platform is spreading election misinformation through its AI systems. For the purpose of this question, 'election misinformation' refers to false or misleading information about election processes, candidates, or results. Credible reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. The reports or warnings must specifically mention the platform and its AI systems' role in spreading election misinformation.
