(2) Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro issues a public remark explicitly condemning the assault on Maria Corina Machado's office that took place in 2023. This remark must be documented by at least two reputable international news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or similar). The condemnation must be clear and unequivocal, directly addressing the incident involving Machado's office. If both criteria are not fulfilled by the resolution date, the inquiry will be resolved as NO.

question.title: Will the Reserve Bank of India announce an interest rate cut by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Reserve Bank of India officially announces a decrease in its repo rate by July 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the Reserve Bank of India or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Monetary Policy Committee and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual RBI members will not count for resolution. If no such official announcement of an interest rate cut is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is it expected that the Reserve Bank of India will declare a reduction in interest rates by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if the Reserve Bank of India makes a formal declaration of a reduction in its repo rate by July 31, 2024. The declaration must be validated through official communications from the Reserve Bank of India or reported by a minimum of two prominent financial news outlets (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate reduction must be an official decision made by the Monetary Policy Committee and conveyed in their formal statement or press briefing after a meeting. Any conjecture regarding potential future rate reductions or unofficial remarks from individual RBI officials will not be counted for resolution. If no such formal announcement regarding an interest rate reduction is made by the specified resolution date, the inquiry will resolve as negative.

question.title: Will Oracle announce measures to reduce AI-related electricity consumption by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Oracle officially announces specific measures aimed at reducing electricity consumption attributed to its AI operations. The announcement must be made through official company channels (such as press releases, blog posts, or annual reports) or reported by at least two major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, Wall Street Journal, New York Times). The measures announced should be concrete steps or initiatives designed to decrease the energy usage of Oracle's AI systems. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, or if the announced measures do not specifically target AI-related electricity consumption, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is Oracle set to reveal strategies for lowering AI-driven energy use by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered YES if, by July 31, 2024, Oracle makes an official declaration of particular strategies intended to diminish electricity use linked to its AI functions. The declaration must be issued through formal company outlets (like press releases, blog entries, or annual reports) or covered by at least two prominent news organizations (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, Wall Street Journal, New York Times). The strategies disclosed should be tangible actions or programs aimed at reducing the energy consumption of Oracle's AI systems. If no such declaration occurs by the stated date, or if the disclosed strategies do not specifically address AI-related electricity consumption, the inquiry resolves as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by July 2024: (a) The Reserve Bank of India announces an interest rate cut, and (b) Oracle announces measures to reduce AI-related electricity consumption?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following occur by July 31, 2024: (a) The Reserve Bank of India officially announces a decrease in its repo rate, confirmed through official statements or reported by at least two major financial news sources. The decision must be made by the Monetary Policy Committee and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. (b) Oracle officially announces specific measures aimed at reducing electricity consumption attributed to its AI operations, through official company channels or reported by at least two major news outlets. The measures must be concrete steps or initiatives designed to decrease the energy usage of Oracle's AI systems. If either or both of these announcements are not made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that both of the following will take place by July 2024: (a) The Reserve Bank of India makes a declaration regarding a reduction in interest rates, and (b) Oracle reveals strategies to lower electricity consumption related to AI?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if both of the following happen by July 31, 2024: (a) The Reserve Bank of India formally declares a reduction in its repo rate, validated through official communications or reported by no fewer than two prominent financial news outlets. This decision must be made by the Monetary Policy Committee and conveyed in their official statement or during a press conference after a meeting. (b) Oracle officially discloses particular strategies aimed at decreasing electricity usage linked to its AI operations, through official company announcements or reported by at least two major news organizations. The strategies must consist of tangible actions or initiatives intended to reduce the energy consumption of Oracle's AI systems. If either or both of these announcements do not occur by the resolution date, the inquiry will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will President Biden deliver a speech at a National Education Association event in Illinois by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, President Joe Biden delivers a speech at any National Education Association (NEA) event held in Illinois. The speech must be confirmed by official White House announcements or reports from at least two reputable news sources. If no such speech occurs by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is it anticipated that President Biden will speak at a National Education Association gathering in Illinois before July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed TRUE if, by July 31, 2024, President Joe Biden gives a speech at any event organized by the National Education Association (NEA) in Illinois. The speech must be verified through official announcements from the White House or reports from a minimum of two credible news outlets. If no speech takes place by the specified resolution date, the inquiry will be considered FALSE.

question.title: Will California receive over $300 million in federal grants for electric vehicle projects by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the state of California is confirmed to have been awarded more than $300 million in federal grants specifically for electric vehicle manufacturing, assembly, or related projects. Confirmation must come from official U.S. government sources (such as the Department of Energy or the White House) or be reported by at least two major national news organizations (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The grants must be explicitly designated for electric vehicle-related initiatives within California. If the total amount of such grants awarded to California does not exceed $300 million by the specified date, or if there is insufficient evidence to confirm such an award, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Is it expected that California will obtain more than $300 million in federal funding for electric vehicle initiatives by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as YES if, by July 31, 2024, it is verified that California has received in excess of $300 million in federal funding specifically allocated for electric vehicle production, assembly, or related projects. Verification must be provided by official U.S. government entities (such as the Department of Energy or the White House) or reported by at least two major national news outlets (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The funding must be clearly earmarked for electric vehicle-related projects within California. If the total federal funding awarded to California does not surpass $300 million by the given date, or if there is inadequate evidence to substantiate such an award, the inquiry will conclude as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by July 2024: (a) President Biden delivers a speech at a National Education Association event in Illinois, and (b) California receives over $300 million in federal grants for electric vehicle projects?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met by July 31, 2024: (a) President Joe Biden delivers a speech at any National Education Association (NEA) event held in Illinois, confirmed by official White House announcements or reports from at least two reputable news sources. (b) The state of California is confirmed to have been awarded more than $300 million in federal grants specifically for electric vehicle manufacturing, assembly, or related projects, with confirmation from official U.S. government sources (such as the Department of Energy or the White House) or reports by at least two major national news organizations (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The grants must be explicitly designated for electric vehicle-related initiatives within California. If either condition is not met by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that by July 2024, both of the following will take place: (a) President Biden gives a speech at a National Education Association event in Illinois, and (b) California obtains more than $300 million in federal funding for electric vehicle initiatives?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with YES if both of the following criteria are satisfied by July 31, 2024: (a) President Joe Biden is confirmed to have spoken at any National Education Association (NEA) event occurring in Illinois, as verified by official announcements from the White House or reports from at least two credible news outlets. (b) It is confirmed that the state of California has received over $300 million in federal funding specifically allocated for electric vehicle manufacturing, assembly, or related projects, with verification from official U.S. government sources (such as the Department of Energy or the White House) or reports from at least two prominent national news organizations (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The funding must be explicitly earmarked for electric vehicle-related projects within California. If either of these conditions is not fulfilled by the resolution date, the answer will be NO.

question.title: Will a major hospital system in the Northeast US cancel over $300 million in medical debt by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, a hospital system based in the Northeast United States, in collaboration with a nonprofit organization, successfully cancels more than $300 million in medical debt for at least 150,000 patients across multiple Northeastern states. The cancellation must be officially announced by the hospital system or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The debt cancellation should target patients who are considered financially needy or unable to pay. If the debt cancellation is not completed or officially confirmed by the specified date, or if the amount cancelled is $300 million or less, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will a significant healthcare provider in the Northeastern United States eliminate over $300 million in medical debt by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, by August 31, 2024, a healthcare provider located in the Northeast US, in partnership with a nonprofit organization, effectively eliminates more than $300 million in medical debt for at least 150,000 patients across several Northeastern states. The cancellation must be publicly announced by the healthcare provider or covered by at least two prominent news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The debt relief should focus on patients deemed financially disadvantaged or unable to pay. If the debt relief is not finalized or officially verified by the given date, or if the total amount forgiven is $300 million or less, the inquiry will be answered with a NO.

question.title: Will Hyundai Motor Company resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if Hyundai Motor Company reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For the resolution to be considered valid:

1. The strike must involve a substantial number of Hyundai Motor Company workers (at least 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must last for at least one week.
3. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Hyundai Motor Company and the involved union.
4. The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will Hyundai Motor Company come to an agreement to end a significant workers' strike before July 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with a YES if Hyundai Motor Company successfully negotiates a deal with its unionized employees, leading to the conclusion of a major strike by July 31, 2024. For a valid resolution:

1. The strike must involve a considerable number of Hyundai Motor Company employees (at least 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must persist for a minimum duration of one week.
3. The resolution has to be verified by official announcements from both Hyundai Motor Company and the participating union.
4. The outcome must be reported by no fewer than two credible international news organizations (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If such a resolution that meets all the above criteria is not reached by the specified date, or if no major strike takes place, the answer will be NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) A major hospital system in the Northeast US cancels over $300 million in medical debt by August 2024, and (b) Hyundai Motor Company resolves a major workers' strike by July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES only if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) By August 31, 2024, a hospital system based in the Northeast United States, in collaboration with a nonprofit organization, cancels more than $300 million in medical debt for at least 150,000 patients across multiple Northeastern states. The cancellation must be officially announced by the hospital system or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The debt cancellation should target patients who are considered financially needy or unable to pay. If the debt cancellation is not completed or officially confirmed by the specified date, or if the amount cancelled is $300 million or less, this condition is not met.

(b) Hyundai Motor Company reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For the resolution to be considered valid, the strike must involve a substantial number of Hyundai Motor Company workers (at least 1,000 participants), last for at least one week, and the resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Hyundai Motor Company and the involved union. Additionally, the resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC). If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, this condition is not met.

The question resolves as NO if either or both conditions are not met.

para_P.title: Are the following two events going to take place: (a) A significant healthcare system in the Northeastern United States eliminates over $300 million in medical debt by the end of August 2024, and (b) Hyundai Motor Company successfully ends a major labor strike by the end of July 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with a YES only if both of the subsequent criteria are satisfied:

(a) By the date of August 31, 2024, a healthcare system located in the Northeast of the United States, working in partnership with a nonprofit entity, forgives more than $300 million in medical debt for a minimum of 150,000 patients across various Northeastern states. This debt forgiveness must be publicly declared by the healthcare system or reported by at least two prominent news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The debt relief should focus on patients deemed financially vulnerable or unable to pay. If the debt forgiveness is not finalized or publicly acknowledged by the given deadline, or if the amount forgiven is $300 million or less, this criterion will not be fulfilled.

(b) Hyundai Motor Company comes to a settlement with unionized employees, leading to the conclusion of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For this resolution to be recognized as valid, the strike must involve a considerable number of Hyundai Motor Company workers (at least 1,000 participants), persist for a minimum duration of one week, and the resolution must be validated by official announcements from both Hyundai Motor Company and the relevant union. Furthermore, the resolution must be covered by at least two credible international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC). If such a resolution that meets all these stipulations is not achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, this criterion will not be satisfied.

The question will be answered with a NO if either or both of the conditions are not fulfilled.

question.title: Will Virginia maintain its current legal stance on abortion access by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Virginia Supreme Court has not reversed or significantly altered its 2023 decision that struck down state laws regulating abortion providers more strictly than other health care providers and banned a common second-trimester procedure. The question will resolve as NO if, by July 31, 2024, the Virginia Supreme Court has reversed this decision, reinstated stricter regulations on abortion providers, or reinstated the ban on the second-trimester procedure. The resolution will be based on official court decisions or credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, The New York Times, The Washington Post).

para_P.title: Will Virginia uphold its existing legal position regarding abortion access by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Virginia Supreme Court has not overturned or substantially modified its 2023 ruling that invalidated state regulations imposing stricter requirements on abortion providers compared to other healthcare providers and prohibited a common procedure in the second trimester. Conversely, the inquiry will be marked as NO if, by July 31, 2024, the Virginia Supreme Court has overturned this ruling, reinstated stricter regulations on abortion providers, or reinstated the prohibition on the second-trimester procedure. The outcome will rely on official court rulings or trustworthy reports from a minimum of three major news outlets (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, The New York Times, The Washington Post).

question.title: Will Florida maintain its current legal stance on abortion access by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Florida Supreme Court has not reversed or significantly altered its 2023 decision that struck down state laws regulating abortion providers more strictly than other health care providers and banned a common second-trimester procedure. The question will resolve as NO if, by July 31, 2024, the Florida Supreme Court has reversed this decision, reinstated stricter regulations on abortion providers, or reinstated the ban on the second-trimester procedure. The resolution will be based on official court decisions or credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, The New York Times, The Washington Post).

para_P.title: Will Florida uphold its existing legal position regarding abortion access by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Florida Supreme Court has not overturned or substantially modified its 2023 ruling that invalidated state laws imposing stricter regulations on abortion providers compared to other healthcare providers and prohibited a standard second-trimester procedure. Conversely, the question will resolve as NO if, by July 31, 2024, the Florida Supreme Court has overturned this ruling, reintroduced stricter regulations on abortion providers, or reinstated the prohibition on the second-trimester procedure. The outcome will rely on official court rulings or reliable reports from at least three prominent news outlets (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, The New York Times, The Washington Post).

question.title: Will both Virginia and Florida maintain their current legal stances on abortion access by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, both the Virginia Supreme Court and the Florida Supreme Court have not reversed or significantly altered their 2023 decisions that struck down state laws regulating abortion providers more strictly than other health care providers and banned a common second-trimester procedure. The question will resolve as NO if, by July 31, 2024, either the Virginia Supreme Court or the Florida Supreme Court has reversed their decision, reinstated stricter regulations on abortion providers, or reinstated the ban on the second-trimester procedure. The resolution will be based on official court decisions or credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, The New York Times, The Washington Post).

para_P.title: Will Virginia and Florida continue to uphold their existing legal positions regarding abortion access by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as YES if, by July 31, 2024, neither the Virginia Supreme Court nor the Florida Supreme Court has overturned or significantly modified their 2023 rulings that invalidated state laws imposing stricter regulations on abortion providers compared to other healthcare providers and prohibited a common second-trimester procedure. Conversely, the inquiry will resolve as NO if, by July 31, 2024, either the Virginia Supreme Court or the Florida Supreme Court has reversed its ruling, reintroduced stricter regulations on abortion providers, or reinstated the prohibition on the second-trimester procedure. The outcome will rely on official court decisions or credible reports from at least three major news outlets (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, The New York Times, The Washington Post).

question.title: Will the SEC announce completion of a major insider trading investigation by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) officially announces the completion of its investigation into insider trading practices involving at least five major companies. Completion must be confirmed through an official SEC announcement or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, or New York Times). If the SEC does not announce the completion of such an investigation by this date, or if the investigation is still ongoing, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will the SEC declare the conclusion of a significant insider trading probe by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) publicly declares that its investigation into insider trading activities involving a minimum of five major firms has concluded. The conclusion must be verified through an official announcement from the SEC or reported by at least two prominent news organizations (such as Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, or New York Times). If the SEC fails to announce the conclusion of such an investigation by this date, or if the investigation remains active, the inquiry will be answered with NO.

question.title: Will the Central Bank of Australia announce a new fiscal policy initiative by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the Central Bank of Australia officially announces a new fiscal policy initiative. The announcement must come from an official Central Bank of Australia communication channel, such as a press release or a public speech by the Governor of the Central Bank of Australia. The announcement should explicitly describe the new fiscal policy initiative. The announcement must be reported by at least two major financial news outlets (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC, Financial Times) to be considered valid. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, or if the Central Bank of Australia does not announce a new fiscal policy initiative, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is a new fiscal policy initiative expected to be announced by the Central Bank of Australia before the end of August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed affirmative if, on or before August 31, 2024, the Central Bank of Australia publicly declares a new fiscal policy initiative. The declaration must originate from an official communication channel of the Central Bank of Australia, such as a press release or a public address by the Governor of the Central Bank of Australia. The announcement must clearly outline the new fiscal policy initiative. Additionally, it must be covered by at least two prominent financial news organizations (for instance, Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC, Financial Times) to be considered legitimate. If such a declaration is not made by the specified deadline, or if the Central Bank of Australia does not unveil a new fiscal policy initiative, the inquiry will resolve as negative.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) the SEC announce completion of a major insider trading investigation by July 2024 and (b) the Central Bank of Australia announce a new fiscal policy initiative by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met: (a) By July 31, 2024, the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) officially announces the completion of its investigation into insider trading practices involving at least five major companies. Completion must be confirmed through an official SEC announcement or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, or New York Times). If the SEC does not announce the completion of such an investigation by this date, or if the investigation is still ongoing, this part resolves as NO. (b) By August 31, 2024, the Central Bank of Australia officially announces a new fiscal policy initiative. The announcement must come from an official Central Bank of Australia communication channel, such as a press release or a public speech by the Governor of the Central Bank of Australia. The announcement should explicitly describe the new fiscal policy initiative. The announcement must be reported by at least two major financial news outlets (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC, Financial Times) to be considered valid. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, or if the Central Bank of Australia does not announce a new fiscal policy initiative, this part resolves as NO. The combined question resolves as YES only if both parts (a) and (b) resolve as YES.

para_P.title: Is it true that (a) the SEC will declare the conclusion of a significant insider trading investigation by July 2024 and (b) the Central Bank of Australia will unveil a new fiscal policy initiative by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry is answered with a YES if both of the following criteria are satisfied: (a) By July 31, 2024, the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) publicly announces the conclusion of its investigation into insider trading activities involving at least five prominent corporations. The conclusion must be verified through an official announcement from the SEC or reported by at least two major news organizations (such as Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, or New York Times). If the SEC does not announce the conclusion of such an investigation by this date, or if the investigation remains active, this part resolves as NO. (b) By August 31, 2024, the Central Bank of Australia makes an official announcement regarding a new fiscal policy initiative. This announcement must be issued through an official channel of the Central Bank of Australia, such as a press release or a public address by the Governor of the Central Bank of Australia. The announcement should clearly outline the new fiscal policy initiative and must be reported by at least two major financial news organizations (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC, Financial Times) to be considered valid. If no such announcement is made by the given date, or if the Central Bank of Australia does not declare a new fiscal policy initiative, this part resolves as NO. The overall question resolves as YES only if both parts (a) and (b) resolve as YES.

question.title: Will IBM lay off at least 1,800 employees by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, IBM has confirmed the layoff of at least 1,800 employees as part of its AI-focused reorganization plan. Confirmation must come from official company announcements, regulatory filings, or reports by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The layoffs must be explicitly linked to the AI-focused reorganization plan announced in 2023. If IBM confirms a lower number of layoffs, or if no such confirmation meeting these criteria is made by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO. Partial layoffs or phased implementations that do not reach the 1,800 employee threshold by the resolution date will also result in a NO resolution.

para_P.title: Will IBM terminate a minimum of 1,800 staff members by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as YES if, by July 31, 2024, IBM has officially acknowledged the termination of at least 1,800 staff members as part of its reorganization strategy centered on AI. Such acknowledgment must come from formal company statements, regulatory submissions, or reports from at least two credible news outlets (like Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The terminations must be directly associated with the AI-centered reorganization strategy unveiled in 2023. If IBM verifies a smaller number of terminations, or if no confirmation meeting these stipulations is provided by the resolution date, the inquiry will conclude as NO. Any partial terminations or staged implementations that do not meet the 1,800 staff member threshold by the resolution date will also lead to a NO conclusion.

question.title: Will Tiff Macklem remain as Governor of the Bank of Canada through July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if Tiff Macklem is still serving as the Governor of the Bank of Canada on July 31, 2024. Confirmation must come from official Bank of Canada announcements or be reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, CNBC, The Wall Street Journal, or Bloomberg). If he is no longer serving as Governor by the resolution date for any reason (including but not limited to resignation, removal, or end of term), the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, any interim or acting Governor appointments will not be considered as Macklem remaining in the position.

para_P.title: Will Tiff Macklem continue to serve as the Governor of the Bank of Canada until the end of July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with YES if Tiff Macklem is still in the role of Governor of the Bank of Canada on July 31, 2024. Verification must be obtained from official announcements by the Bank of Canada or reported by at least two prominent news organizations (such as Reuters, CNBC, The Wall Street Journal, or Bloomberg). If he is no longer in the position of Governor by the resolution date for any reason (including but not limited to resignation, removal, or conclusion of term), the answer will be NO. For the purposes of this inquiry, any appointments of interim or acting Governors will not be counted as Macklem continuing in the role.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by July 2024: (a) IBM will lay off at least 1,800 employees as part of its AI-focused reorganization plan, and (b) Tiff Macklem will remain as Governor of the Bank of Canada?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met by July 31, 2024: (a) IBM has confirmed the layoff of at least 1,800 employees as part of its AI-focused reorganization plan. Confirmation must come from official company announcements, regulatory filings, or reports by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The layoffs must be explicitly linked to the AI-focused reorganization plan announced in 2023. If IBM confirms a lower number of layoffs, or if no such confirmation meeting these criteria is made by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO. Partial layoffs or phased implementations that do not reach the 1,800 employee threshold by the resolution date will also result in a NO resolution. (b) Tiff Macklem is still serving as the Governor of the Bank of Canada on July 31, 2024. Confirmation must come from official Bank of Canada announcements or be reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, CNBC, The Wall Street Journal, or Bloomberg). If he is no longer serving as Governor by the resolution date for any reason (including but not limited to resignation, removal, or end of term), the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, any interim or acting Governor appointments will not be considered as Macklem remaining in the position.

para_P.title: Is it true that by July 2024, both (a) IBM will have laid off a minimum of 1,800 employees as part of its reorganization strategy focused on AI, and (b) Tiff Macklem will continue his role as the Governor of the Bank of Canada?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed YES if both of the following criteria are fulfilled by July 31, 2024: (a) IBM has officially announced the layoff of at least 1,800 employees in connection with its AI-centered reorganization plan. This confirmation must originate from official company statements, regulatory disclosures, or reports from a minimum of two credible news organizations (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The layoffs must be directly associated with the AI-focused reorganization plan that was revealed in 2023. If IBM verifies a lesser number of layoffs, or if no confirmation meeting these requirements is available by the resolution date, the outcome will be NO. Partial layoffs or gradual implementations that do not achieve the 1,800 employee cutoff by the resolution date will also result in a NO outcome. (b) Tiff Macklem is still in his position as the Governor of the Bank of Canada on July 31, 2024. Confirmation must be sourced from official announcements from the Bank of Canada or reported by at least two prominent news outlets (such as Reuters, CNBC, The Wall Street Journal, or Bloomberg). If he is no longer in the role of Governor by the resolution date for any reason (including but not limited to resignation, removal, or end of term), the outcome will resolve as NO. For this question, any interim or acting Governor appointments will not be considered as Macklem remaining in the role.

question.title: Will North Carolina enact a new law modifying restrictions on medical care for transgender youth by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the state of North Carolina enacts a new law that modifies or replaces the current restrictions on medical care for transgender youth. The enactment must be confirmed through official state legislative records and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or local North Carolina news stations). The new law must specifically address and alter the existing restrictions on medical care for transgender youth in North Carolina. If no such law is enacted by the resolution date, or if any enacted law does not modify the current restrictions, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: By July 2024, will there be a new law in North Carolina that changes the current regulations on medical treatment for transgender minors?

The interest rate reduction must be a formal decision made by the Governing Board and conveyed in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. question.body:

2. This declaration must be reported by at least two major international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, CNN).
3. The declaration must specifically refer to the Nigerian Lassa fever outbreak, not a global Lassa fever situation in general.

The question will resolve as NO if:
1. The WHO does not make such a declaration by August 31, 2024.
2. The WHO makes a declaration about Lassa fever that does not specifically address the Nigerian outbreak.
3. The WHO maintains or escalates the emergency status of the Nigerian Lassa fever outbreak.

Note: If the WHO has already declared the Nigerian Lassa fever outbreak no longer a global emergency prior to this question's start date, the question will still resolve based on the status as of August 31, 2024.

para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if the World Health Organization (WHO) formally announces the end of the ongoing avian influenza outbreak by August 31, 2024. The conclusion must be validated through official communications from the WHO or confirmed by at least three credible news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC). The outbreak in question is the one that led to increased global public health measures. If such an announcement declaring the outbreak's end is not made by the resolution date, or if the WHO prolongs the emergency status past August 31, 2024, the answer will be NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by August 2024: (a) The Singapore Straits Times Index reaches or exceeds 4,000 points, and (b) The World Health Organization declares the current bird flu outbreak over?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met: (a) The Singapore Straits Times Index reaches or exceeds 4,000 points at any time between October 1, 2023, and August 31, 2024. This includes intraday highs, based on official reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the Singapore Exchange. (b) The World Health Organization (WHO) officially declares the ongoing bird flu outbreak over by August 31, 2024, as confirmed through official WHO announcements or reports from at least three reputable news sources such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC. If either condition is not met, this question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: By August 2024, will the following two events take place: (a) The Singapore Straits Times Index hits or surpasses 4,000 points, and (b) The World Health Organization announces the conclusion of the current bird flu outbreak?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered YES if both of the subsequent criteria are satisfied: (a) The Singapore Straits Times Index reaches or goes beyond 4,000 points at any moment from October 1, 2023, to August 31, 2024. This includes intraday peaks, according to official data from credible financial market information providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the Singapore Exchange. (b) The World Health Organization (WHO) officially states that the ongoing bird flu outbreak has ended by August 31, 2024, as verified through official WHO statements or reports from at least three trustworthy news organizations such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC. If either criterion is unmet, this inquiry will be deemed NO.
